Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code encountered critical variable scope errors that prevented any searches from executing. Primary issues: (1) NameError: 'headers' is not defined - the headers dictionary defined at module level is not accessible within the perform_search() function, causing all 18 searches to fail immediately, (2) NameError: 'file' is not defined in the final file listing section. The code structure and search queries are well-designed for the **PLAN** requirements (Robertson brothers 1839 novel, Saunders & Otley publisher, Scottish/Welsh setting, Dickens illustrator research), but execution stops on the first search attempt due to Python scoping issues. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no searches completed, no data collected, no analysis performed. The output shows 0 successful searches out of 18 total attempts. Recommended fix: Move both 'headers' and 'search_base_url' variable definitions inside the perform_search() function, and fix the file listing loop variable. This is a straightforward scoping issue that can be resolved by relocating the variable definitions to be accessible within the function context.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from urllib.parse import quote_plus print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL PUBLISHED BY SAUNDERS AND OTLEY ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Also searching for: Dickens illustrator who created "The Great 100 Rat Match" c.1858') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries novel_search_queries = [ 'Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson fiction 1839', 'Scotland Wales orphan clerk Glasgow novel 1839', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" Saunders Otley 1839', 'Robertson brothers novel 1839 Scotland Wales', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson Scottish novel', 'Glasgow orphan clerk novel 1839 Robertson', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley publisher', 'Robertson 1839 three volume novel Scotland', 'Scottish novel 1839 orphan Glasgow Wales Robertson' ] illustrator_search_queries = [ 'Dickens illustrator Great 100 Rat Match 1858', '"The Great 100 Rat Match" 1858 illustrator', 'Charles Dickens illustrator rat match 1858', 'Victorian illustrator Great Rat Match Dickens', 'Dickens artist Great 100 Rat Match circa 1858', '1858 rat match illustration Dickens artist', 'Great Rat Match illustrator Victorian era', 'Dickens collaborator illustrator 1858 rats' ] print('=== STEP 1: SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL ===') print(f'Novel search queries: {len(novel_search_queries)}') for i, query in enumerate(novel_search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') print(f'\nIllustrator search queries: {len(illustrator_search_queries)}') for i, query in enumerate(illustrator_search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') search_results = {} # Function to perform search and analyze results def perform_search(query, search_index, search_type): """Perform a single search and analyze results""" # FIXED: Define all required variables inside the function to avoid scope issues search_base_url = 'https://html.duckduckgo.com/html/' headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } print(f'\n--- {search_type.upper()} SEARCH {search_index}: {query} ---') try: params = {'q': query} response = requests.get(search_base_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save raw HTML for analysis clean_query = query.replace(' ', '_').replace('"', '').replace("'", '').replace('/', '_')[:50] filename = f'{search_type}_search_{search_index:02d}_{clean_query}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved: {filepath}') # Parse for relevant results soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for result links with relevant information result_links = [] for link in soup.find_all('a', href=True): href = link.get('href') text = link.get_text().strip() if href and text and len(text) > 15: text_lower = text.lower() relevance_score = 0 if search_type == 'novel': # High-value terms for novel identification novel_terms = [ ('robertson', 4), ('j.p. robertson', 5), ('w.p. robertson', 5), ('saunders', 4), ('otley', 4), ('saunders and otley', 6), ('1839', 5), ('scotland', 3), ('wales', 3), ('glasgow', 3), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 3), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('three volume', 3), ('volume', 2), ('victorian', 2) ] # Calculate relevance score for novel search for term, score in novel_terms: if term in text_lower: relevance_score += score elif search_type == 'illustrator': # High-value terms for illustrator identification illustrator_terms = [ ('dickens', 4), ('charles dickens', 5), ('great 100 rat match', 8), ('rat match', 5), ('great rat match', 6), ('1858', 4), ('illustrator', 4), ('artist', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('victorian', 2), ('circa 1858', 5), ('rats', 2) ] # Calculate relevance score for illustrator search for term, score in illustrator_terms: if term in text_lower: relevance_score += score # Bonus for authoritative domains if href: href_lower = href.lower() if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['worldcat.org', 'bl.uk', 'loc.gov']): relevance_score += 4 if relevance_score >= 3: # Only include relevant results result_links.append({ 'url': href, 'text': text[:500], # Extended text for better analysis 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'search_type': search_type }) # Sort by relevance score result_links.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Return results instead of using global variable search_result = { 'query': query, 'html_file': filepath, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'relevant_links': result_links[:20], # Top 20 most relevant 'total_links_found': len(result_links) } print(f'Found {len(result_links)} relevant links') if result_links: print('Top results:') for i, link in enumerate(result_links[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. Score {link["relevance_score"]}: {link["text"][:120]}...') print(f' URL: {link["url"]}') time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting return search_result else: print(f'Failed: HTTP {response.status_code}') return None except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') return None # Execute novel searches print('\n=== EXECUTING NOVEL SEARCHES ===') novel_successful = 0 for i, query in enumerate(novel_search_queries, 1): result = perform_search(query, i, 'novel') if result: search_results[f'novel_{i}'] = result novel_successful += 1 if i < len(novel_search_queries): time.sleep(1) # Execute illustrator searches print('\n=== EXECUTING ILLUSTRATOR SEARCHES ===') illustrator_successful = 0 for i, query in enumerate(illustrator_search_queries, 1): result = perform_search(query, i, 'illustrator') if result: search_results[f'illustrator_{i}'] = result illustrator_successful += 1 if i < len(illustrator_search_queries): time.sleep(1) print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS ===') print(f'Novel searches successful: {novel_successful}/{len(novel_search_queries)}') print(f'Illustrator searches successful: {illustrator_successful}/{len(illustrator_search_queries)}') # Analyze novel findings novel_findings = [] novel_titles = set() publisher_confirmations = 0 author_confirmations = 0 year_confirmations = 0 scottish_setting_confirmations = 0 print('\n--- ANALYZING NOVEL SEARCH RESULTS ---') for key, results in search_results.items(): if key.startswith('novel_'): print(f'\nQuery: "{results["query"]}"') print(f' Relevant links: {results["total_links_found"]}') for link in results['relevant_links']: text_lower = link['text'].lower() # Check for key novel identifiers has_robertson = 'robertson' in text_lower has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in text_lower and 'otley' in text_lower has_1839 = '1839' in text_lower has_scotland = 'scotland' in text_lower or 'scottish' in text_lower has_wales = 'wales' in text_lower or 'welsh' in text_lower has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in text_lower has_orphan = 'orphan' in text_lower has_clerk = 'clerk' in text_lower # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([ has_robertson * 3, has_saunders_otley * 4, has_1839 * 3, has_scotland * 2, has_wales * 2, has_glasgow * 2, has_orphan * 2, has_clerk * 2 ]) if novel_score >= 5: # High novel relevance print(f' 🎯 HIGH NOVEL RELEVANCE: Score {novel_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, Saunders/Otley: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' 1839: {has_1839}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Text: {link["text"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {link["url"]}') novel_findings.append({ 'query': results['query'], 'text': link['text'], 'url': link['url'], 'relevance_score': link['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'has_robertson': has_robertson, 'has_saunders_otley': has_saunders_otley, 'has_1839': has_1839, 'has_scottish_setting': has_scotland or has_wales or has_glasgow }) # Track confirmations if has_saunders_otley: publisher_confirmations += 1 if has_robertson: author_confirmations += 1 if has_1839: year_confirmations += 1 if has_scotland or has_wales or has_glasgow: scottish_setting_confirmations += 1 # Extract potential novel titles text_lines = link['text'].split('\n') for line in text_lines: line_clean = line.strip() if (len(line_clean) > 10 and len(line_clean) < 150 and ('robertson' in line_clean.lower() or '1839' in line_clean) and any(word in line_clean.lower() for word in ['novel', 'story', 'tale', 'volume'])): novel_titles.add(line_clean) # Analyze illustrator findings illustrator_findings = [] illustrator_names = set() dickens_connections = 0 rat_match_confirmations = 0 print('\n--- ANALYZING ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH RESULTS ---') for key, results in search_results.items(): if key.startswith('illustrator_'): print(f'\nQuery: "{results["query"]}"') print(f' Relevant links: {results["total_links_found"]}') for link in results['relevant_links']: text_lower = link['text'].lower() # Check for key illustrator identifiers has_dickens = 'dickens' in text_lower has_rat_match = 'rat match' in text_lower or 'great 100 rat match' in text_lower has_1858 = '1858' in text_lower has_illustrator = 'illustrator' in text_lower or 'artist' in text_lower has_illustration = 'illustration' in text_lower or 'drawing' in text_lower # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([ has_dickens * 3, has_rat_match * 5, has_1858 * 3, has_illustrator * 2, has_illustration * 2 ]) if illustrator_score >= 5: # High illustrator relevance print(f' 🎨 HIGH ILLUSTRATOR RELEVANCE: Score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' 1858: {has_1858}, Illustrator: {has_illustrator}') print(f' Text: {link["text"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {link["url"]}') illustrator_findings.append({ 'query': results['query'], 'text': link['text'], 'url': link['url'], 'relevance_score': link['relevance_score'], 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'has_dickens': has_dickens, 'has_rat_match': has_rat_match, 'has_1858': has_1858 }) # Track confirmations if has_dickens: dickens_connections += 1 if has_rat_match: rat_match_confirmations += 1 # Extract potential illustrator names - simple pattern matching words = link['text'].split() for i, word in enumerate(words): if (word.istitle() and i < len(words) - 1 and words[i + 1].istitle() and len(word) > 2 and len(words[i + 1]) > 2): potential_name = f'{word} {words[i + 1]}' if ('illustrator' in link['text'].lower() or 'artist' in link['text'].lower()): illustrator_names.add(potential_name) print(f'\n=== STEP 3: COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f'\n📖 NOVEL SEARCH RESULTS:') print(f' High-relevance novel findings: {len(novel_findings)}') print(f' Publisher confirmations (Saunders & Otley): {publisher_confirmations}') print(f' Author confirmations (Robertson): {author_confirmations}') print(f' Year confirmations (1839): {year_confirmations}') print(f' Scottish setting confirmations: {scottish_setting_confirmations}') print(f' Potential novel titles identified: {len(novel_titles)}') print(f'\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH RESULTS:') print(f' High-relevance illustrator findings: {len(illustrator_findings)}') print(f' Dickens connections: {dickens_connections}') print(f' Rat Match confirmations: {rat_match_confirmations}') print(f' Potential illustrator names: {len(illustrator_names)}') # Display top findings if novel_findings: print(f'\n🏆 TOP NOVEL FINDINGS:') novel_findings.sort(key=lambda x: x['novel_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(novel_findings[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. NOVEL FINDING (Score: {finding["novel_score"]})') print(f' Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f' Robertson: {finding["has_robertson"]}, Saunders/Otley: {finding["has_saunders_otley"]}') print(f' 1839: {finding["has_1839"]}, Scottish Setting: {finding["has_scottish_setting"]}') print(f' URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f' Text: {finding["text"][:300]}...') if illustrator_findings: print(f'\n🎨 TOP ILLUSTRATOR FINDINGS:') illustrator_findings.sort(key=lambda x: x['illustrator_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(illustrator_findings[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. ILLUSTRATOR FINDING (Score: {finding["illustrator_score"]})') print(f' Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f' Dickens: {finding["has_dickens"]}, Rat Match: {finding["has_rat_match"]}, 1858: {finding["has_1858"]}') print(f' URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f' Text: {finding["text"][:300]}...') if novel_titles: print(f'\n📚 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_titles), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_names: print(f'\n👨‍🎨 POTENTIAL ILLUSTRATOR NAMES:') for i, name in enumerate(sorted(illustrator_names), 1): print(f' {i}. {name}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers 1839 novel published by Saunders and Otley, and identify its Dickens-associated illustrator', 'novel_criteria': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': 1839, 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow' }, 'illustrator_criteria': { 'connection': 'Known for working with Charles Dickens', 'specific_work': 'The Great 100 Rat Match', 'year': 'circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'novel_queries': len(novel_search_queries), 'novel_successful_searches': novel_successful, 'illustrator_queries': len(illustrator_search_queries), 'illustrator_successful_searches': illustrator_successful, 'total_search_results': len(search_results) }, 'novel_analysis': { 'high_relevance_findings': len(novel_findings), 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'author_confirmations': author_confirmations, 'year_confirmations': year_confirmations, 'scottish_setting_confirmations': scottish_setting_confirmations, 'potential_titles': list(novel_titles), 'top_findings': novel_findings[:10] if novel_findings else [] }, 'illustrator_analysis': { 'high_relevance_findings': len(illustrator_findings), 'dickens_connections': dickens_connections, 'rat_match_confirmations': rat_match_confirmations, 'potential_names': list(illustrator_names), 'top_findings': illustrator_findings[:10] if illustrator_findings else [] }, 'search_queries': { 'novel_queries': novel_search_queries, 'illustrator_queries': illustrator_search_queries }, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_novel_illustrator_search_analysis.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {novel_successful} successful novel searches') print(f'✓ Conducted {illustrator_successful} successful illustrator searches') print(f'✓ Found {len(novel_findings)} high-relevance novel findings') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_findings)} high-relevance illustrator findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_titles)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Identified {len(illustrator_names)} potential illustrator names') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if novel_findings: top_novel = novel_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING NOVEL LEAD:') print(f'Score: {top_novel["novel_score"]}') print(f'URL: {top_novel["url"]}') print(f'Has all key elements: Robertson={top_novel["has_robertson"]}, Saunders/Otley={top_novel["has_saunders_otley"]}, 1839={top_novel["has_1839"]}') if illustrator_findings: top_illustrator = illustrator_findings[0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST PROMISING ILLUSTRATOR LEAD:') print(f'Score: {top_illustrator["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'URL: {top_illustrator["url"]}') print(f'Has key elements: Dickens={top_illustrator["has_dickens"]}, Rat Match={top_illustrator["has_rat_match"]}, 1858={top_illustrator["has_1858"]}') print('\n=== FILES CREATED ===') # FIXED: Use proper iteration to avoid variable scope issues workspace_files = [] try: for filename in sorted(os.listdir('workspace')): if any(term in filename for term in ['novel_search', 'illustrator_search', 'robertson']): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) workspace_files.append(f'- {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print(f'- {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') except Exception as e: print(f'Error listing files: {str(e)}') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review top novel findings for specific title identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from highest-scoring results') print('3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications') print('4. Research illustrator connections to both Dickens and Robertson novel') print('5. Look for bibliographic records confirming the novel-illustrator connection')
Execution Output

2025-08-13 02:35:24
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 5)

Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from ddgs import DDGS print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL PUBLISHED BY SAUNDERS AND OTLEY ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Also searching for: Dickens illustrator who created "The Great 100 Rat Match" c.1858') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries novel_search_queries = [ 'Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson fiction 1839', 'Scotland Wales orphan clerk Glasgow novel 1839', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" Saunders Otley 1839', 'Robertson brothers novel 1839 Scotland Wales', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson Scottish novel', 'Glasgow orphan clerk novel 1839 Robertson', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley publisher', 'Robertson 1839 three volume novel Scotland', 'Scottish novel 1839 orphan Glasgow Wales Robertson' ] illustrator_search_queries = [ 'Dickens illustrator Great 100 Rat Match 1858', '"The Great 100 Rat Match" 1858 illustrator', 'Charles Dickens illustrator rat match 1858', 'Victorian illustrator Great Rat Match Dickens', 'Dickens artist Great 100 Rat Match circa 1858', '1858 rat match illustration Dickens artist', 'Great Rat Match illustrator Victorian era', 'Dickens collaborator illustrator 1858 rats' ] print('=== STEP 1: SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL ===') print(f'Novel search queries: {len(novel_search_queries)}') for i, query in enumerate(novel_search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') print(f'\nIllustrator search queries: {len(illustrator_search_queries)}') for i, query in enumerate(illustrator_search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') # Initialize search engine searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) all_search_results = {} # Function to perform search and analyze results def perform_ddg_search(query, search_index, search_type): """Perform a single search using DuckDuckGo and analyze results""" print(f'\n--- {search_type.upper()} SEARCH {search_index}: {query} ---') try: # Use DuckDuckGo search with multiple backends backend = ["google", "duckduckgo", "yandex", "brave", "bing"] results = searcher.text(query, max_results=15, backend=backend, safesearch="off", region="en-us") if not results: print(f'No results found for: {query}') return None print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Process and score results processed_results = [] for i, result in enumerate(results): title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') href = result.get('href', '') # Combine title and body for analysis combined_text = f"{title} {body}".lower() relevance_score = 0 if search_type == 'novel': # High-value terms for novel identification novel_terms = [ ('robertson', 4), ('j.p. robertson', 5), ('w.p. robertson', 5), ('saunders', 4), ('otley', 4), ('saunders and otley', 6), ('1839', 5), ('scotland', 3), ('wales', 3), ('glasgow', 3), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 3), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('three volume', 3), ('volume', 2), ('victorian', 2) ] # Calculate relevance score for novel search for term, score in novel_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_score += score elif search_type == 'illustrator': # High-value terms for illustrator identification illustrator_terms = [ ('dickens', 4), ('charles dickens', 5), ('great 100 rat match', 8), ('rat match', 5), ('great rat match', 6), ('1858', 4), ('illustrator', 4), ('artist', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('victorian', 2), ('circa 1858', 5), ('rats', 2) ] # Calculate relevance score for illustrator search for term, score in illustrator_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_score += score # Bonus for authoritative domains if href: href_lower = href.lower() if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['worldcat.org', 'bl.uk', 'loc.gov']): relevance_score += 4 if relevance_score >= 3: # Only include relevant results processed_results.append({ 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'search_type': search_type, 'combined_text': combined_text }) # Sort by relevance score processed_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Save results search_result = { 'query': query, 'search_type': search_type, 'total_results': len(results), 'relevant_results': processed_results[:10], # Top 10 most relevant 'total_relevant': len(processed_results) } if processed_results: print('Top relevant results:') for i, result in enumerate(processed_results[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["title"][:100]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') return search_result except Exception as e: print(f'Error in search: {str(e)}') return None # Execute novel searches print('\n=== EXECUTING NOVEL SEARCHES ===') novel_successful = 0 for i, query in enumerate(novel_search_queries, 1): result = perform_ddg_search(query, i, 'novel') if result: all_search_results[f'novel_{i}'] = result novel_successful += 1 # Brief pause between searches time.sleep(2) # Execute illustrator searches print('\n=== EXECUTING ILLUSTRATOR SEARCHES ===') illustrator_successful = 0 for i, query in enumerate(illustrator_search_queries, 1): result = perform_ddg_search(query, i, 'illustrator') if result: all_search_results[f'illustrator_{i}'] = result illustrator_successful += 1 # Brief pause between searches time.sleep(2) print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS ===') print(f'Novel searches successful: {novel_successful}/{len(novel_search_queries)}') print(f'Illustrator searches successful: {illustrator_successful}/{len(illustrator_search_queries)}') # Analyze novel findings novel_findings = [] novel_titles = set() publisher_confirmations = 0 author_confirmations = 0 year_confirmations = 0 scottish_setting_confirmations = 0 print('\n--- ANALYZING NOVEL SEARCH RESULTS ---') for key, results in all_search_results.items(): if key.startswith('novel_'): print(f'\nQuery: "{results["query"]}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["total_relevant"]} out of {results["total_results"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: combined_text = result['combined_text'] # Check for key novel identifiers has_robertson = 'robertson' in combined_text has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in combined_text and 'otley' in combined_text has_1839 = '1839' in combined_text has_scotland = 'scotland' in combined_text or 'scottish' in combined_text has_wales = 'wales' in combined_text or 'welsh' in combined_text has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in combined_text has_orphan = 'orphan' in combined_text has_clerk = 'clerk' in combined_text # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([ has_robertson * 3, has_saunders_otley * 4, has_1839 * 3, has_scotland * 2, has_wales * 2, has_glasgow * 2, has_orphan * 2, has_clerk * 2 ]) if novel_score >= 5: # High novel relevance print(f' 🎯 HIGH NOVEL RELEVANCE: Score {novel_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, Saunders/Otley: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' 1839: {has_1839}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') novel_findings.append({ 'query': results['query'], 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'has_robertson': has_robertson, 'has_saunders_otley': has_saunders_otley, 'has_1839': has_1839, 'has_scottish_setting': has_scotland or has_wales or has_glasgow }) # Track confirmations if has_saunders_otley: publisher_confirmations += 1 if has_robertson: author_confirmations += 1 if has_1839: year_confirmations += 1 if has_scotland or has_wales or has_glasgow: scottish_setting_confirmations += 1 # Extract potential novel titles title_text = result['title'] if (len(title_text) > 10 and len(title_text) < 150 and ('robertson' in title_text.lower() or '1839' in title_text) and any(word in title_text.lower() for word in ['novel', 'story', 'tale', 'volume'])): novel_titles.add(title_text) # Analyze illustrator findings illustrator_findings = [] illustrator_names = set() dickens_connections = 0 rat_match_confirmations = 0 print('\n--- ANALYZING ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH RESULTS ---') for key, results in all_search_results.items(): if key.startswith('illustrator_'): print(f'\nQuery: "{results["query"]}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["total_relevant"]} out of {results["total_results"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: combined_text = result['combined_text'] # Check for key illustrator identifiers has_dickens = 'dickens' in combined_text has_rat_match = 'rat match' in combined_text or 'great 100 rat match' in combined_text has_1858 = '1858' in combined_text has_illustrator = 'illustrator' in combined_text or 'artist' in combined_text has_illustration = 'illustration' in combined_text or 'drawing' in combined_text # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([ has_dickens * 3, has_rat_match * 5, has_1858 * 3, has_illustrator * 2, has_illustration * 2 ]) if illustrator_score >= 5: # High illustrator relevance print(f' 🎨 HIGH ILLUSTRATOR RELEVANCE: Score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' 1858: {has_1858}, Illustrator: {has_illustrator}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') illustrator_findings.append({ 'query': results['query'], 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'has_dickens': has_dickens, 'has_rat_match': has_rat_match, 'has_1858': has_1858 }) # Track confirmations if has_dickens: dickens_connections += 1 if has_rat_match: rat_match_confirmations += 1 # Extract potential illustrator names from title and body full_text = f"{result['title']} {result['body']}" words = full_text.split() for i, word in enumerate(words): if (word.istitle() and i < len(words) - 1 and words[i + 1].istitle() and len(word) > 2 and len(words[i + 1]) > 2): potential_name = f'{word} {words[i + 1]}' if ('illustrator' in full_text.lower() or 'artist' in full_text.lower()): illustrator_names.add(potential_name) print(f'\n=== STEP 3: COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f'\n📖 NOVEL SEARCH RESULTS:') print(f' High-relevance novel findings: {len(novel_findings)}') print(f' Publisher confirmations (Saunders & Otley): {publisher_confirmations}') print(f' Author confirmations (Robertson): {author_confirmations}') print(f' Year confirmations (1839): {year_confirmations}') print(f' Scottish setting confirmations: {scottish_setting_confirmations}') print(f' Potential novel titles identified: {len(novel_titles)}') print(f'\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH RESULTS:') print(f' High-relevance illustrator findings: {len(illustrator_findings)}') print(f' Dickens connections: {dickens_connections}') print(f' Rat Match confirmations: {rat_match_confirmations}') print(f' Potential illustrator names: {len(illustrator_names)}') # Display top findings if novel_findings: print(f'\n🏆 TOP NOVEL FINDINGS:') novel_findings.sort(key=lambda x: x['novel_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(novel_findings[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. NOVEL FINDING (Score: {finding["novel_score"]})') print(f' Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f' Robertson: {finding["has_robertson"]}, Saunders/Otley: {finding["has_saunders_otley"]}') print(f' 1839: {finding["has_1839"]}, Scottish Setting: {finding["has_scottish_setting"]}') print(f' Title: {finding["title"]}') print(f' URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f' Body: {finding["body"][:200]}...') if illustrator_findings: print(f'\n🎨 TOP ILLUSTRATOR FINDINGS:') illustrator_findings.sort(key=lambda x: x['illustrator_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(illustrator_findings[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. ILLUSTRATOR FINDING (Score: {finding["illustrator_score"]})') print(f' Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f' Dickens: {finding["has_dickens"]}, Rat Match: {finding["has_rat_match"]}, 1858: {finding["has_1858"]}') print(f' Title: {finding["title"]}') print(f' URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f' Body: {finding["body"][:200]}...') if novel_titles: print(f'\n📚 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_titles), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_names: print(f'\n👨‍🎨 POTENTIAL ILLUSTRATOR NAMES:') for i, name in enumerate(sorted(illustrator_names), 1): print(f' {i}. {name}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers 1839 novel published by Saunders and Otley, and identify its Dickens-associated illustrator', 'novel_criteria': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': 1839, 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow' }, 'illustrator_criteria': { 'connection': 'Known for working with Charles Dickens', 'specific_work': 'The Great 100 Rat Match', 'year': 'circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'novel_queries': len(novel_search_queries), 'novel_successful_searches': novel_successful, 'illustrator_queries': len(illustrator_search_queries), 'illustrator_successful_searches': illustrator_successful, 'total_search_results': len(all_search_results) }, 'novel_analysis': { 'high_relevance_findings': len(novel_findings), 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'author_confirmations': author_confirmations, 'year_confirmations': year_confirmations, 'scottish_setting_confirmations': scottish_setting_confirmations, 'potential_titles': list(novel_titles), 'top_findings': novel_findings[:10] if novel_findings else [] }, 'illustrator_analysis': { 'high_relevance_findings': len(illustrator_findings), 'dickens_connections': dickens_connections, 'rat_match_confirmations': rat_match_confirmations, 'potential_names': list(illustrator_names), 'top_findings': illustrator_findings[:10] if illustrator_findings else [] }, 'search_queries': { 'novel_queries': novel_search_queries, 'illustrator_queries': illustrator_search_queries }, 'raw_search_results': all_search_results, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_novel_illustrator_comprehensive_search.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {novel_successful} successful novel searches') print(f'✓ Conducted {illustrator_successful} successful illustrator searches') print(f'✓ Found {len(novel_findings)} high-relevance novel findings') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_findings)} high-relevance illustrator findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_titles)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Identified {len(illustrator_names)} potential illustrator names') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if novel_findings: top_novel = novel_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING NOVEL LEAD:') print(f'Score: {top_novel["novel_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_novel["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_novel["url"]}') print(f'Has key elements: Robertson={top_novel["has_robertson"]}, Saunders/Otley={top_novel["has_saunders_otley"]}, 1839={top_novel["has_1839"]}') if illustrator_findings: top_illustrator = illustrator_findings[0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST PROMISING ILLUSTRATOR LEAD:') print(f'Score: {top_illustrator["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_illustrator["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_illustrator["url"]}') print(f'Has key elements: Dickens={top_illustrator["has_dickens"]}, Rat Match={top_illustrator["has_rat_match"]}, 1858={top_illustrator["has_1858"]}') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Execution failed - The code has a critical error that prevents completion of the **PLAN** objectives. Primary issue: NameError: 'searcher' is not defined on line 70 - the code imports DDGS and attempts to use 'searcher' variable but never actually initializes it with DDGS(). All 18 searches (10 novel + 8 illustrator) failed with this error, preventing any data collection for the Robertson brothers 1839 novel or Dickens illustrator research specified in the **PLAN**. The code shows mixed/corrupted output with unrelated cycling and French TV content, suggesting execution environment issues. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no searches completed due to undefined searcher variable. Simple fix needed: Add 'searcher = DDGS(timeout=10)' initialization before the search loops, or move the existing initialization line to the correct location. The search queries and analysis logic are properly designed for the **PLAN** requirements, but the basic DDGS setup is broken.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from ddgs import DDGS print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL PUBLISHED BY SAUNDERS AND OTLEY ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Also searching for: Dickens illustrator who created "The Great 100 Rat Match" c.1858') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries novel_search_queries = [ 'Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson fiction 1839', 'Scotland Wales orphan clerk Glasgow novel 1839', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" Saunders Otley 1839', 'Robertson brothers novel 1839 Scotland Wales', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson Scottish novel', 'Glasgow orphan clerk novel 1839 Robertson', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley publisher', 'Robertson 1839 three volume novel Scotland', 'Scottish novel 1839 orphan Glasgow Wales Robertson' ] illustrator_search_queries = [ 'Dickens illustrator Great 100 Rat Match 1858', '"The Great 100 Rat Match" 1858 illustrator', 'Charles Dickens illustrator rat match 1858', 'Victorian illustrator Great Rat Match Dickens', 'Dickens artist Great 100 Rat Match circa 1858', '1858 rat match illustration Dickens artist', 'Great Rat Match illustrator Victorian era', 'Dickens collaborator illustrator 1858 rats' ] print('=== STEP 1: SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL ===') print(f'Novel search queries: {len(novel_search_queries)}') for i, query in enumerate(novel_search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') print(f'\nIllustrator search queries: {len(illustrator_search_queries)}') for i, query in enumerate(illustrator_search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') # Initialize search engine searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) all_search_results = {} # Function to perform search and analyze results def perform_ddg_search(query, search_index, search_type): """Perform a single search using DuckDuckGo and analyze results""" print(f'\n--- {search_type.upper()} SEARCH {search_index}: {query} ---') try: # Use DuckDuckGo search with multiple backends backend = ["google", "duckduckgo", "yandex", "brave", "bing"] results = searcher.text(query, max_results=15, backend=backend, safesearch="off", region="en-us") if not results: print(f'No results found for: {query}') return None print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Process and score results processed_results = [] for i, result in enumerate(results): title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') href = result.get('href', '') # Combine title and body for analysis combined_text = f"{title} {body}".lower() relevance_score = 0 if search_type == 'novel': # High-value terms for novel identification novel_terms = [ ('robertson', 4), ('j.p. robertson', 5), ('w.p. robertson', 5), ('saunders', 4), ('otley', 4), ('saunders and otley', 6), ('1839', 5), ('scotland', 3), ('wales', 3), ('glasgow', 3), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 3), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('three volume', 3), ('volume', 2), ('victorian', 2) ] # Calculate relevance score for novel search for term, score in novel_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_score += score elif search_type == 'illustrator': # High-value terms for illustrator identification illustrator_terms = [ ('dickens', 4), ('charles dickens', 5), ('great 100 rat match', 8), ('rat match', 5), ('great rat match', 6), ('1858', 4), ('illustrator', 4), ('artist', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('victorian', 2), ('circa 1858', 5), ('rats', 2) ] # Calculate relevance score for illustrator search for term, score in illustrator_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_score += score # Bonus for authoritative domains if href: href_lower = href.lower() if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['worldcat.org', 'bl.uk', 'loc.gov']): relevance_score += 4 if relevance_score >= 3: # Only include relevant results processed_results.append({ 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'search_type': search_type, 'combined_text': combined_text }) # Sort by relevance score processed_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Save results search_result = { 'query': query, 'search_type': search_type, 'total_results': len(results), 'relevant_results': processed_results[:10], # Top 10 most relevant 'total_relevant': len(processed_results) } if processed_results: print('Top relevant results:') for i, result in enumerate(processed_results[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["title"][:100]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') return search_result except Exception as e: print(f'Error in search: {str(e)}') return None # Execute novel searches print('\n=== EXECUTING NOVEL SEARCHES ===') novel_successful = 0 for i, query in enumerate(novel_search_queries, 1): result = perform_ddg_search(query, i, 'novel') if result: all_search_results[f'novel_{i}'] = result novel_successful += 1 # Brief pause between searches time.sleep(2) # Execute illustrator searches print('\n=== EXECUTING ILLUSTRATOR SEARCHES ===') illustrator_successful = 0 for i, query in enumerate(illustrator_search_queries, 1): result = perform_ddg_search(query, i, 'illustrator') if result: all_search_results[f'illustrator_{i}'] = result illustrator_successful += 1 # Brief pause between searches time.sleep(2) print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS ===') print(f'Novel searches successful: {novel_successful}/{len(novel_search_queries)}') print(f'Illustrator searches successful: {illustrator_successful}/{len(illustrator_search_queries)}') # Analyze novel findings novel_findings = [] novel_titles = set() publisher_confirmations = 0 author_confirmations = 0 year_confirmations = 0 scottish_setting_confirmations = 0 print('\n--- ANALYZING NOVEL SEARCH RESULTS ---') for key, results in all_search_results.items(): if key.startswith('novel_'): print(f'\nQuery: "{results["query"]}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["total_relevant"]} out of {results["total_results"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: combined_text = result['combined_text'] # Check for key novel identifiers has_robertson = 'robertson' in combined_text has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in combined_text and 'otley' in combined_text has_1839 = '1839' in combined_text has_scotland = 'scotland' in combined_text or 'scottish' in combined_text has_wales = 'wales' in combined_text or 'welsh' in combined_text has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in combined_text has_orphan = 'orphan' in combined_text has_clerk = 'clerk' in combined_text # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([ has_robertson * 3, has_saunders_otley * 4, has_1839 * 3, has_scotland * 2, has_wales * 2, has_glasgow * 2, has_orphan * 2, has_clerk * 2 ]) if novel_score >= 5: # High novel relevance print(f' 🎯 HIGH NOVEL RELEVANCE: Score {novel_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, Saunders/Otley: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' 1839: {has_1839}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') novel_findings.append({ 'query': results['query'], 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'has_robertson': has_robertson, 'has_saunders_otley': has_saunders_otley, 'has_1839': has_1839, 'has_scottish_setting': has_scotland or has_wales or has_glasgow }) # Track confirmations if has_saunders_otley: publisher_confirmations += 1 if has_robertson: author_confirmations += 1 if has_1839: year_confirmations += 1 if has_scotland or has_wales or has_glasgow: scottish_setting_confirmations += 1 # Extract potential novel titles title_text = result['title'] if (len(title_text) > 10 and len(title_text) < 150 and ('robertson' in title_text.lower() or '1839' in title_text) and any(word in title_text.lower() for word in ['novel', 'story', 'tale', 'volume'])): novel_titles.add(title_text) # Analyze illustrator findings illustrator_findings = [] illustrator_names = set() dickens_connections = 0 rat_match_confirmations = 0 print('\n--- ANALYZING ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH RESULTS ---') for key, results in all_search_results.items(): if key.startswith('illustrator_'): print(f'\nQuery: "{results["query"]}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["total_relevant"]} out of {results["total_results"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: combined_text = result['combined_text'] # Check for key illustrator identifiers has_dickens = 'dickens' in combined_text has_rat_match = 'rat match' in combined_text or 'great 100 rat match' in combined_text has_1858 = '1858' in combined_text has_illustrator = 'illustrator' in combined_text or 'artist' in combined_text has_illustration = 'illustration' in combined_text or 'drawing' in combined_text # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([ has_dickens * 3, has_rat_match * 5, has_1858 * 3, has_illustrator * 2, has_illustration * 2 ]) if illustrator_score >= 5: # High illustrator relevance print(f' 🎨 HIGH ILLUSTRATOR RELEVANCE: Score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' 1858: {has_1858}, Illustrator: {has_illustrator}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') illustrator_findings.append({ 'query': results['query'], 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'has_dickens': has_dickens, 'has_rat_match': has_rat_match, 'has_1858': has_1858 }) # Track confirmations if has_dickens: dickens_connections += 1 if has_rat_match: rat_match_confirmations += 1 # Extract potential illustrator names from title and body full_text = f"{result['title']} {result['body']}" words = full_text.split() for i, word in enumerate(words): if (word.istitle() and i < len(words) - 1 and words[i + 1].istitle() and len(word) > 2 and len(words[i + 1]) > 2): potential_name = f'{word} {words[i + 1]}' if ('illustrator' in full_text.lower() or 'artist' in full_text.lower()): illustrator_names.add(potential_name) print(f'\n=== STEP 3: COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f'\n📖 NOVEL SEARCH RESULTS:') print(f' High-relevance novel findings: {len(novel_findings)}') print(f' Publisher confirmations (Saunders & Otley): {publisher_confirmations}') print(f' Author confirmations (Robertson): {author_confirmations}') print(f' Year confirmations (1839): {year_confirmations}') print(f' Scottish setting confirmations: {scottish_setting_confirmations}') print(f' Potential novel titles identified: {len(novel_titles)}') print(f'\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH RESULTS:') print(f' High-relevance illustrator findings: {len(illustrator_findings)}') print(f' Dickens connections: {dickens_connections}') print(f' Rat Match confirmations: {rat_match_confirmations}') print(f' Potential illustrator names: {len(illustrator_names)}') # Display top findings if novel_findings: print(f'\n🏆 TOP NOVEL FINDINGS:') novel_findings.sort(key=lambda x: x['novel_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(novel_findings[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. NOVEL FINDING (Score: {finding["novel_score"]})') print(f' Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f' Robertson: {finding["has_robertson"]}, Saunders/Otley: {finding["has_saunders_otley"]}') print(f' 1839: {finding["has_1839"]}, Scottish Setting: {finding["has_scottish_setting"]}') print(f' Title: {finding["title"]}') print(f' URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f' Body: {finding["body"][:200]}...') if illustrator_findings: print(f'\n🎨 TOP ILLUSTRATOR FINDINGS:') illustrator_findings.sort(key=lambda x: x['illustrator_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(illustrator_findings[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. ILLUSTRATOR FINDING (Score: {finding["illustrator_score"]})') print(f' Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f' Dickens: {finding["has_dickens"]}, Rat Match: {finding["has_rat_match"]}, 1858: {finding["has_1858"]}') print(f' Title: {finding["title"]}') print(f' URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f' Body: {finding["body"][:200]}...') if novel_titles: print(f'\n📚 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_titles), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_names: print(f'\n👨‍🎨 POTENTIAL ILLUSTRATOR NAMES:') for i, name in enumerate(sorted(illustrator_names), 1): print(f' {i}. {name}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers 1839 novel published by Saunders and Otley, and identify its Dickens-associated illustrator', 'novel_criteria': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': 1839, 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow' }, 'illustrator_criteria': { 'connection': 'Known for working with Charles Dickens', 'specific_work': 'The Great 100 Rat Match', 'year': 'circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'novel_queries': len(novel_search_queries), 'novel_successful_searches': novel_successful, 'illustrator_queries': len(illustrator_search_queries), 'illustrator_successful_searches': illustrator_successful, 'total_search_results': len(all_search_results) }, 'novel_analysis': { 'high_relevance_findings': len(novel_findings), 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'author_confirmations': author_confirmations, 'year_confirmations': year_confirmations, 'scottish_setting_confirmations': scottish_setting_confirmations, 'potential_titles': list(novel_titles), 'top_findings': novel_findings[:10] if novel_findings else [] }, 'illustrator_analysis': { 'high_relevance_findings': len(illustrator_findings), 'dickens_connections': dickens_connections, 'rat_match_confirmations': rat_match_confirmations, 'potential_names': list(illustrator_names), 'top_findings': illustrator_findings[:10] if illustrator_findings else [] }, 'search_queries': { 'novel_queries': novel_search_queries, 'illustrator_queries': illustrator_search_queries }, 'raw_search_results': all_search_results, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_novel_illustrator_comprehensive_search.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {novel_successful} successful novel searches') print(f'✓ Conducted {illustrator_successful} successful illustrator searches') print(f'✓ Found {len(novel_findings)} high-relevance novel findings') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_findings)} high-relevance illustrator findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_titles)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Identified {len(illustrator_names)} potential illustrator names') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if novel_findings: top_novel = novel_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING NOVEL LEAD:') print(f'Score: {top_novel["novel_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_novel["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_novel["url"]}') print(f'Has key elements: Robertson={top_novel["has_robertson"]}, Saunders/Otley={top_novel["has_saunders_otley"]}, 1839={top_novel["has_1839"]}') if illustrator_findings: top_illustrator = illustrator_findings[0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST PROMISING ILLUSTRATOR LEAD:') print(f'Score: {top_illustrator["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_illustrator["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_illustrator["url"]}') print(f'Has key elements: Dickens={top_illustrator["has_dickens"]}, Rat Match={top_illustrator["has_rat_match"]}, 1858={top_illustrator["has_1858"]}') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review top novel findings for specific title identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from highest-scoring results') print('3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications') print('4. Research illustrator connections to both Dickens and Robertson novel') print('5. Look for bibliographic records confirming the novel-illustrator connection') print('6. Check the comprehensive JSON file for detailed search results and analysis')

Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 6)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json import time from ddgs import DDGS print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL PUBLISHED BY SAUNDERS AND OTLEY ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Also searching for: Dickens illustrator who created "The Great 100 Rat Match" c.1858') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries novel_search_queries = [ 'Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson fiction 1839', 'Scotland Wales orphan clerk Glasgow novel 1839', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" Saunders Otley 1839', 'Robertson brothers novel 1839 Scotland Wales', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson Scottish novel', 'Glasgow orphan clerk novel 1839 Robertson', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley publisher', 'Robertson 1839 three volume novel Scotland', 'Scottish novel 1839 orphan Glasgow Wales Robertson' ] illustrator_search_queries = [ 'Dickens illustrator Great 100 Rat Match 1858', '"The Great 100 Rat Match" 1858 illustrator', 'Charles Dickens illustrator rat match 1858', 'Victorian illustrator Great Rat Match Dickens', 'Dickens artist Great 100 Rat Match circa 1858', '1858 rat match illustration Dickens artist', 'Great Rat Match illustrator Victorian era', 'Dickens collaborator illustrator 1858 rats' ] print('=== STEP 1: SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL ===') print(f'Novel search queries: {len(novel_search_queries)}') for i, query in enumerate(novel_search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') print(f'\nIllustrator search queries: {len(illustrator_search_queries)}') for i, query in enumerate(illustrator_search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') # Initialize the search engine properly print('\n=== INITIALIZING SEARCH ENGINE ===') try: searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) print('✓ DDGS searcher initialized successfully') except Exception as e: print(f'✗ Error initializing DDGS: {str(e)}') searcher = None all_search_results = {} # Function to perform search and analyze results def perform_ddg_search(query, search_index, search_type, search_engine): """Perform a single search using DuckDuckGo and analyze results""" print(f'\n--- {search_type.upper()} SEARCH {search_index}: {query} ---') if not search_engine: print('✗ Search engine not available') return None try: # Use DuckDuckGo search with multiple backends backend = ["google", "duckduckgo", "yandex", "brave", "bing"] results = search_engine.text(query, max_results=15, backend=backend, safesearch="off", region="en-us") if not results: print(f'No results found for: {query}') return None print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Process and score results processed_results = [] for i, result in enumerate(results): title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') href = result.get('href', '') # Combine title and body for analysis combined_text = f"{title} {body}".lower() relevance_score = 0 if search_type == 'novel': # High-value terms for novel identification novel_terms = [ ('robertson', 4), ('j.p. robertson', 5), ('w.p. robertson', 5), ('saunders', 4), ('otley', 4), ('saunders and otley', 6), ('1839', 5), ('scotland', 3), ('wales', 3), ('glasgow', 3), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 3), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('three volume', 3), ('volume', 2), ('victorian', 2) ] # Calculate relevance score for novel search for term, score in novel_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_score += score elif search_type == 'illustrator': # High-value terms for illustrator identification illustrator_terms = [ ('dickens', 4), ('charles dickens', 5), ('great 100 rat match', 8), ('rat match', 5), ('great rat match', 6), ('1858', 4), ('illustrator', 4), ('artist', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('victorian', 2), ('circa 1858', 5), ('rats', 2) ] # Calculate relevance score for illustrator search for term, score in illustrator_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_score += score # Bonus for authoritative domains if href: href_lower = href.lower() if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['worldcat.org', 'bl.uk', 'loc.gov']): relevance_score += 4 if relevance_score >= 3: # Only include relevant results processed_results.append({ 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'search_type': search_type, 'combined_text': combined_text }) # Sort by relevance score processed_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Save results search_result = { 'query': query, 'search_type': search_type, 'total_results': len(results), 'relevant_results': processed_results[:10], # Top 10 most relevant 'total_relevant': len(processed_results) } if processed_results: print('Top relevant results:') for i, result in enumerate(processed_results[:3], 1): print(f' {i}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["title"][:100]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') else: print('No highly relevant results found') return search_result except Exception as e: print(f'Error in search: {str(e)}') return None # Execute novel searches print('\n=== EXECUTING NOVEL SEARCHES ===') novel_successful = 0 for i, query in enumerate(novel_search_queries, 1): result = perform_ddg_search(query, i, 'novel', searcher) if result: all_search_results[f'novel_{i}'] = result novel_successful += 1 # Brief pause between searches time.sleep(2) # Execute illustrator searches print('\n=== EXECUTING ILLUSTRATOR SEARCHES ===') illustrator_successful = 0 for i, query in enumerate(illustrator_search_queries, 1): result = perform_ddg_search(query, i, 'illustrator', searcher) if result: all_search_results[f'illustrator_{i}'] = result illustrator_successful += 1 # Brief pause between searches time.sleep(2) print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS ===') print(f'Novel searches successful: {novel_successful}/{len(novel_search_queries)}') print(f'Illustrator searches successful: {illustrator_successful}/{len(illustrator_search_queries)}') # Analyze novel findings novel_findings = [] novel_titles = set() publisher_confirmations = 0 author_confirmations = 0 year_confirmations = 0 scottish_setting_confirmations = 0 print('\n--- ANALYZING NOVEL SEARCH RESULTS ---') for key, results in all_search_results.items(): if key.startswith('novel_'): print(f'\nQuery: "{results["query"]}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["total_relevant"]} out of {results["total_results"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: combined_text = result['combined_text'] # Check for key novel identifiers has_robertson = 'robertson' in combined_text has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in combined_text and 'otley' in combined_text has_1839 = '1839' in combined_text has_scotland = 'scotland' in combined_text or 'scottish' in combined_text has_wales = 'wales' in combined_text or 'welsh' in combined_text has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in combined_text has_orphan = 'orphan' in combined_text has_clerk = 'clerk' in combined_text # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([ has_robertson * 3, has_saunders_otley * 4, has_1839 * 3, has_scotland * 2, has_wales * 2, has_glasgow * 2, has_orphan * 2, has_clerk * 2 ]) if novel_score >= 5: # High novel relevance print(f' 🎯 HIGH NOVEL RELEVANCE: Score {novel_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, Saunders/Otley: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' 1839: {has_1839}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') novel_findings.append({ 'query': results['query'], 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'has_robertson': has_robertson, 'has_saunders_otley': has_saunders_otley, 'has_1839': has_1839, 'has_scottish_setting': has_scotland or has_wales or has_glasgow }) # Track confirmations if has_saunders_otley: publisher_confirmations += 1 if has_robertson: author_confirmations += 1 if has_1839: year_confirmations += 1 if has_scotland or has_wales or has_glasgow: scottish_setting_confirmations += 1 # Extract potential novel titles title_text = result['title'] if (len(title_text) > 10 and len(title_text) < 150 and ('robertson' in title_text.lower() or '1839' in title_text) and any(word in title_text.lower() for word in ['novel', 'story', 'tale', 'volume'])): novel_titles.add(title_text) # Analyze illustrator findings illustrator_findings = [] illustrator_names = set() dickens_connections = 0 rat_match_confirmations = 0 print('\n--- ANALYZING ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH RESULTS ---') for key, results in all_search_results.items(): if key.startswith('illustrator_'): print(f'\nQuery: "{results["query"]}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["total_relevant"]} out of {results["total_results"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: combined_text = result['combined_text'] # Check for key illustrator identifiers has_dickens = 'dickens' in combined_text has_rat_match = 'rat match' in combined_text or 'great 100 rat match' in combined_text has_1858 = '1858' in combined_text has_illustrator = 'illustrator' in combined_text or 'artist' in combined_text has_illustration = 'illustration' in combined_text or 'drawing' in combined_text # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([ has_dickens * 3, has_rat_match * 5, has_1858 * 3, has_illustrator * 2, has_illustration * 2 ]) if illustrator_score >= 5: # High illustrator relevance print(f' 🎨 HIGH ILLUSTRATOR RELEVANCE: Score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' 1858: {has_1858}, Illustrator: {has_illustrator}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') illustrator_findings.append({ 'query': results['query'], 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'has_dickens': has_dickens, 'has_rat_match': has_rat_match, 'has_1858': has_1858 }) # Track confirmations if has_dickens: dickens_connections += 1 if has_rat_match: rat_match_confirmations += 1 # Extract potential illustrator names from title and body full_text = f"{result['title']} {result['body']}" words = full_text.split() for i, word in enumerate(words): if (word.istitle() and i < len(words) - 1 and words[i + 1].istitle() and len(word) > 2 and len(words[i + 1]) > 2): potential_name = f'{word} {words[i + 1]}' if ('illustrator' in full_text.lower() or 'artist' in full_text.lower()): illustrator_names.add(potential_name) print(f'\n=== STEP 3: COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f'\n📖 NOVEL SEARCH RESULTS:') print(f' High-relevance novel findings: {len(novel_findings)}') print(f' Publisher confirmations (Saunders & Otley): {publisher_confirmations}') print(f' Author confirmations (Robertson): {author_confirmations}') print(f' Year confirmations (1839): {year_confirmations}') print(f' Scottish setting confirmations: {scottish_setting_confirmations}') print(f' Potential novel titles identified: {len(novel_titles)}') print(f'\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH RESULTS:') print(f' High-relevance illustrator findings: {len(illustrator_findings)}') print(f' Dickens connections: {dickens_connections}') print(f' Rat Match confirmations: {rat_match_confirmations}') print(f' Potential illustrator names: {len(illustrator_names)}') # Display top findings if novel_findings: print(f'\n🏆 TOP NOVEL FINDINGS:') novel_findings.sort(key=lambda x: x['novel_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(novel_findings[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. NOVEL FINDING (Score: {finding["novel_score"]})') print(f' Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f' Robertson: {finding["has_robertson"]}, Saunders/Otley: {finding["has_saunders_otley"]}') print(f' 1839: {finding["has_1839"]}, Scottish Setting: {finding["has_scottish_setting"]}') print(f' Title: {finding["title"]}') print(f' URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f' Body: {finding["body"][:200]}...') if illustrator_findings: print(f'\n🎨 TOP ILLUSTRATOR FINDINGS:') illustrator_findings.sort(key=lambda x: x['illustrator_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(illustrator_findings[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. ILLUSTRATOR FINDING (Score: {finding["illustrator_score"]})') print(f' Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f' Dickens: {finding["has_dickens"]}, Rat Match: {finding["has_rat_match"]}, 1858: {finding["has_1858"]}') print(f' Title: {finding["title"]}') print(f' URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f' Body: {finding["body"][:200]}...') if novel_titles: print(f'\n📚 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_titles), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_names: print(f'\n👨‍🎨 POTENTIAL ILLUSTRATOR NAMES:') for i, name in enumerate(sorted(illustrator_names), 1): print(f' {i}. {name}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers 1839 novel published by Saunders and Otley, and identify its Dickens-associated illustrator', 'novel_criteria': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': 1839, 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow' }, 'illustrator_criteria': { 'connection': 'Known for working with Charles Dickens', 'specific_work': 'The Great 100 Rat Match', 'year': 'circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'novel_queries': len(novel_search_queries), 'novel_successful_searches': novel_successful, 'illustrator_queries': len(illustrator_search_queries), 'illustrator_successful_searches': illustrator_successful, 'total_search_results': len(all_search_results) }, 'novel_analysis': { 'high_relevance_findings': len(novel_findings), 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'author_confirmations': author_confirmations, 'year_confirmations': year_confirmations, 'scottish_setting_confirmations': scottish_setting_confirmations, 'potential_titles': list(novel_titles), 'top_findings': novel_findings[:10] if novel_findings else [] }, 'illustrator_analysis': { 'high_relevance_findings': len(illustrator_findings), 'dickens_connections': dickens_connections, 'rat_match_confirmations': rat_match_confirmations, 'potential_names': list(illustrator_names), 'top_findings': illustrator_findings[:10] if illustrator_findings else [] }, 'search_queries': { 'novel_queries': novel_search_queries, 'illustrator_queries': illustrator_search_queries }, 'raw_search_results': all_search_results, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_novel_illustrator_comprehensive_search.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {novel_successful} successful novel searches') print(f'✓ Conducted {illustrator_successful} successful illustrator searches') print(f'✓ Found {len(novel_findings)} high-relevance novel findings') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_findings)} high-relevance illustrator findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_titles)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Identified {len(illustrator_names)} potential illustrator names') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if novel_findings: top_novel = novel_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING NOVEL LEAD:') print(f'Score: {top_novel["novel_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_novel["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_novel["url"]}') print(f'Has key elements: Robertson={top_novel["has_robertson"]}, Saunders/Otley={top_novel["has_saunders_otley"]}, 1839={top_novel["has_1839"]}') if illustrator_findings: top_illustrator = illustrator_findings[0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST PROMISING ILLUSTRATOR LEAD:') print(f'Score: {top_illustrator["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_illustrator["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_illustrator["url"]}') print(f'Has key elements: Dickens={top_illustrator["has_dickens"]}, Rat Match={top_illustrator["has_rat_match"]}, 1858={top_illustrator["has_1858"]}') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review top novel findings for specific title identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from highest-scoring results') print('3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications') print('4. Research illustrator connections to both Dickens and Robertson novel') print('5. Look for bibliographic records confirming the novel-illustrator connection') print('6. Check the comprehensive JSON file for detailed search results and analysis')
Execution Output

Robertson Publisher: Saunders and Otley Year: 1839 Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow Also searching for: Dickens illustrator who created "The Great 100 Rat Match" c.1858 ==================================================================================================== === STEP 1: SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL === Novel search queries: 10 1.
