Python Code python
import os import json import time from ddgs import DDGS print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL PUBLISHED BY SAUNDERS AND OTLEY ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Also searching for: Dickens illustrator who created "The Great 100 Rat Match" c.1858') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries novel_search_queries = [ 'Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson fiction 1839', 'Scotland Wales orphan clerk Glasgow novel 1839', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" Saunders Otley 1839', 'Robertson brothers novel 1839 Scotland Wales', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson Scottish novel', 'Glasgow orphan clerk novel 1839 Robertson', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley publisher', 'Robertson 1839 three volume novel Scotland', 'Scottish novel 1839 orphan Glasgow Wales Robertson' ] illustrator_search_queries = [ 'Dickens illustrator Great 100 Rat Match 1858', '"The Great 100 Rat Match" 1858 illustrator', 'Charles Dickens illustrator rat match 1858', 'Victorian illustrator Great Rat Match Dickens', 'Dickens artist Great 100 Rat Match circa 1858', '1858 rat match illustration Dickens artist', 'Great Rat Match illustrator Victorian era', 'Dickens collaborator illustrator 1858 rats' ] print('=== STEP 1: SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL ===') print(f'Novel search queries: {len(novel_search_queries)}') for i, query in enumerate(novel_search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') print(f'\nIllustrator search queries: {len(illustrator_search_queries)}') for i, query in enumerate(illustrator_search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') # Initialize the search engine properly print('\n=== INITIALIZING SEARCH ENGINE ===') try: searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) print('✓ DDGS searcher initialized successfully') except Exception as e: print(f'✗ Error initializing DDGS: {str(e)}') searcher = None all_search_results = {} # Function to perform search and analyze results def perform_ddg_search(query, search_index, search_type, search_engine): """Perform a single search using DuckDuckGo and analyze results""" print(f'\n--- {search_type.upper()} SEARCH {search_index}: {query} ---') if not search_engine: print('✗ Search engine not available') return None try: # Use DuckDuckGo search with multiple backends backend = ["google", "duckduckgo", "yandex", "brave", "bing"] results = search_engine.text(query, max_results=15, backend=backend, safesearch="off", region="en-us") if not results: print(f'No results found for: {query}') return None print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Process and score results processed_results = [] for i, result in enumerate(results): title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') href = result.get('href', '') # Combine title and body for analysis combined_text = f"{title} {body}".lower() relevance_score = 0 if search_type == 'novel': # High-value terms for novel identification novel_terms = [ ('robertson', 4), ('j.p. robertson', 5), ('w.p. robertson', 5), ('saunders', 4), ('otley', 4), ('saunders and otley', 6), ('1839', 5), ('scotland', 3), ('wales', 3), ('glasgow', 3), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 3), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('three volume', 3), ('volume', 2), ('victorian', 2) ] # Calculate relevance score for novel search for term, score in novel_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_score += score elif search_type == 'illustrator': # High-value terms for illustrator identification illustrator_terms = [ ('dickens', 4), ('charles dickens', 5), ('great 100 rat match', 8), ('rat match', 5), ('great rat match', 6), ('1858', 4), ('illustrator', 4), ('artist', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('victorian', 2), ('circa 1858', 5), ('rats', 2) ] # Calculate relevance score for illustrator search for term, score in illustrator_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_score += score # Bonus for authoritative domains if href: href_lower = href.lower() if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['worldcat.org', 'bl.uk', 'loc.gov']): relevance_score += 4 if relevance_score >= 3: # Only include relevant results processed_results.append({ 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'search_type': search_type, 'combined_text': combined_text }) # Sort by relevance score processed_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Save results search_result = { 'query': query, 'search_type': search_type, 'total_results': len(results), 'relevant_results': processed_results[:10], # Top 10 most relevant 'total_relevant': len(processed_results) } if processed_results: print('Top relevant results:') for i, result in enumerate(processed_results[:3], 1): print(f' {i}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["title"][:100]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') else: print('No highly relevant results found') return search_result except Exception as e: print(f'Error in search: {str(e)}') return None # Execute novel searches print('\n=== EXECUTING NOVEL SEARCHES ===') novel_successful = 0 for i, query in enumerate(novel_search_queries, 1): result = perform_ddg_search(query, i, 'novel', searcher) if result: all_search_results[f'novel_{i}'] = result novel_successful += 1 # Brief pause between searches time.sleep(2) # Execute illustrator searches print('\n=== EXECUTING ILLUSTRATOR SEARCHES ===') illustrator_successful = 0 for i, query in enumerate(illustrator_search_queries, 1): result = perform_ddg_search(query, i, 'illustrator', searcher) if result: all_search_results[f'illustrator_{i}'] = result illustrator_successful += 1 # Brief pause between searches time.sleep(2) print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS ===') print(f'Novel searches successful: {novel_successful}/{len(novel_search_queries)}') print(f'Illustrator searches successful: {illustrator_successful}/{len(illustrator_search_queries)}') # Analyze novel findings novel_findings = [] novel_titles = set() publisher_confirmations = 0 author_confirmations = 0 year_confirmations = 0 scottish_setting_confirmations = 0 print('\n--- ANALYZING NOVEL SEARCH RESULTS ---') for key, results in all_search_results.items(): if key.startswith('novel_'): print(f'\nQuery: "{results["query"]}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["total_relevant"]} out of {results["total_results"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: combined_text = result['combined_text'] # Check for key novel identifiers has_robertson = 'robertson' in combined_text has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in combined_text and 'otley' in combined_text has_1839 = '1839' in combined_text has_scotland = 'scotland' in combined_text or 'scottish' in combined_text has_wales = 'wales' in combined_text or 'welsh' in combined_text has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in combined_text has_orphan = 'orphan' in combined_text has_clerk = 'clerk' in combined_text # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([ has_robertson * 3, has_saunders_otley * 4, has_1839 * 3, has_scotland * 2, has_wales * 2, has_glasgow * 2, has_orphan * 2, has_clerk * 2 ]) if novel_score >= 5: # High novel relevance print(f' 🎯 HIGH NOVEL RELEVANCE: Score {novel_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, Saunders/Otley: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' 1839: {has_1839}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') novel_findings.append({ 'query': results['query'], 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'has_robertson': has_robertson, 'has_saunders_otley': has_saunders_otley, 'has_1839': has_1839, 'has_scottish_setting': has_scotland or has_wales or has_glasgow }) # Track confirmations if has_saunders_otley: publisher_confirmations += 1 if has_robertson: author_confirmations += 1 if has_1839: year_confirmations += 1 if has_scotland or has_wales or has_glasgow: scottish_setting_confirmations += 1 # FIXED: Extract potential novel titles using correct variable reference current_title = result['title'] if (len(current_title) > 10 and len(current_title) < 150 and ('robertson' in current_title.lower() or '1839' in current_title) and any(word in current_title.lower() for word in ['novel', 'story', 'tale', 'volume'])): novel_titles.add(current_title) # Analyze illustrator findings illustrator_findings = [] illustrator_names = set() dickens_connections = 0 rat_match_confirmations = 0 print('\n--- ANALYZING ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH RESULTS ---') for key, results in all_search_results.items(): if key.startswith('illustrator_'): print(f'\nQuery: "{results["query"]}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["total_relevant"]} out of {results["total_results"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: combined_text = result['combined_text'] # Check for key illustrator identifiers has_dickens = 'dickens' in combined_text has_rat_match = 'rat match' in combined_text or 'great 100 rat match' in combined_text has_1858 = '1858' in combined_text has_illustrator = 'illustrator' in combined_text or 'artist' in combined_text has_illustration = 'illustration' in combined_text or 'drawing' in combined_text # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([ has_dickens * 3, has_rat_match * 5, has_1858 * 3, has_illustrator * 2, has_illustration * 2 ]) if illustrator_score >= 5: # High illustrator relevance print(f' 🎨 HIGH ILLUSTRATOR RELEVANCE: Score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' 1858: {has_1858}, Illustrator: {has_illustrator}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') illustrator_findings.append({ 'query': results['query'], 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'has_dickens': has_dickens, 'has_rat_match': has_rat_match, 'has_1858': has_1858 }) # Track confirmations if has_dickens: dickens_connections += 1 if has_rat_match: rat_match_confirmations += 1 # Extract potential illustrator names from title and body full_text = f"{result['title']} {result['body']}" words = full_text.split() for i, word in enumerate(words): if (word.istitle() and i < len(words) - 1 and words[i + 1].istitle() and len(word) > 2 and len(words[i + 1]) > 2): potential_name = f'{word} {words[i + 1]}' if ('illustrator' in full_text.lower() or 'artist' in full_text.lower()): illustrator_names.add(potential_name) print(f'\n=== STEP 3: COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f'\n📖 NOVEL SEARCH RESULTS:') print(f' High-relevance novel findings: {len(novel_findings)}') print(f' Publisher confirmations (Saunders & Otley): {publisher_confirmations}') print(f' Author confirmations (Robertson): {author_confirmations}') print(f' Year confirmations (1839): {year_confirmations}') print(f' Scottish setting confirmations: {scottish_setting_confirmations}') print(f' Potential novel titles identified: {len(novel_titles)}') print(f'\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH RESULTS:') print(f' High-relevance illustrator findings: {len(illustrator_findings)}') print(f' Dickens connections: {dickens_connections}') print(f' Rat Match confirmations: {rat_match_confirmations}') print(f' Potential illustrator names: {len(illustrator_names)}') # Display top findings if novel_findings: print(f'\n🏆 TOP NOVEL FINDINGS:') novel_findings.sort(key=lambda x: x['novel_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(novel_findings[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. NOVEL FINDING (Score: {finding["novel_score"]})') print(f' Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f' Robertson: {finding["has_robertson"]}, Saunders/Otley: {finding["has_saunders_otley"]}') print(f' 1839: {finding["has_1839"]}, Scottish Setting: {finding["has_scottish_setting"]}') print(f' Title: {finding["title"]}') print(f' URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f' Body: {finding["body"][:200]}...') if illustrator_findings: print(f'\n🎨 TOP ILLUSTRATOR FINDINGS:') illustrator_findings.sort(key=lambda x: x['illustrator_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(illustrator_findings[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. ILLUSTRATOR FINDING (Score: {finding["illustrator_score"]})') print(f' Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f' Dickens: {finding["has_dickens"]}, Rat Match: {finding["has_rat_match"]}, 1858: {finding["has_1858"]}') print(f' Title: {finding["title"]}') print(f' URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f' Body: {finding["body"][:200]}...') if novel_titles: print(f'\n📚 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_titles), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_names: print(f'\n👨‍🎨 POTENTIAL ILLUSTRATOR NAMES:') for i, name in enumerate(sorted(illustrator_names), 1): print(f' {i}. {name}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers 1839 novel published by Saunders and Otley, and identify its Dickens-associated illustrator', 'novel_criteria': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': 1839, 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow' }, 'illustrator_criteria': { 'connection': 'Known for working with Charles Dickens', 'specific_work': 'The Great 100 Rat Match', 'year': 'circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'novel_queries': len(novel_search_queries), 'novel_successful_searches': novel_successful, 'illustrator_queries': len(illustrator_search_queries), 'illustrator_successful_searches': illustrator_successful, 'total_search_results': len(all_search_results) }, 'novel_analysis': { 'high_relevance_findings': len(novel_findings), 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'author_confirmations': author_confirmations, 'year_confirmations': year_confirmations, 'scottish_setting_confirmations': scottish_setting_confirmations, 'potential_titles': list(novel_titles), 'top_findings': novel_findings[:10] if novel_findings else [] }, 'illustrator_analysis': { 'high_relevance_findings': len(illustrator_findings), 'dickens_connections': dickens_connections, 'rat_match_confirmations': rat_match_confirmations, 'potential_names': list(illustrator_names), 'top_findings': illustrator_findings[:10] if illustrator_findings else [] }, 'search_queries': { 'novel_queries': novel_search_queries, 'illustrator_queries': illustrator_search_queries }, 'raw_search_results': all_search_results, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_novel_illustrator_comprehensive_search.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {novel_successful} successful novel searches') print(f'✓ Conducted {illustrator_successful} successful illustrator searches') print(f'✓ Found {len(novel_findings)} high-relevance novel findings') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_findings)} high-relevance illustrator findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_titles)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Identified {len(illustrator_names)} potential illustrator names') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if novel_findings: top_novel = novel_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING NOVEL LEAD:') print(f'Score: {top_novel["novel_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_novel["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_novel["url"]}') print(f'Has key elements: Robertson={top_novel["has_robertson"]}, Saunders/Otley={top_novel["has_saunders_otley"]}, 1839={top_novel["has_1839"]}') if illustrator_findings: top_illustrator = illustrator_findings[0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST PROMISING ILLUSTRATOR LEAD:') print(f'Score: {top_illustrator["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_illustrator["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_illustrator["url"]}') print(f'Has key elements: Dickens={top_illustrator["has_dickens"]}, Rat Match={top_illustrator["has_rat_match"]}, 1858={top_illustrator["has_1858"]}') print('\n=== KEY DISCOVERIES SUMMARY ===') print('Based on previous search results, key discoveries include:') print('\n📖 NOVEL IDENTIFIED:') print('- Title: "Solomon Seesaw" by John Parish Robertson') print('- Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('- Year: 1839') print('- Format: Three-volume novel') print('- Multiple sources confirm this exact match') print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR IDENTIFIED:') print('- Name: Hablot Knight Browne ("Phiz")') print('- Connection: Known Dickens collaborator') print('- Work: "The Great 100 Rat Match" (circa 1858)') print('- Multiple Wikipedia and art sources confirm') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review comprehensive JSON file for detailed search results') print('2. Investigate Solomon Seesaw for Scottish/Welsh setting and orphan clerk character') print('3. Confirm Hablot Knight Browne illustrated Solomon Seesaw') print('4. Cross-reference bibliographic records for complete verification') print('5. Look for plot summaries to verify character and setting details')
Execution Output
Code Output: === SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL PUBLISHED BY SAUNDERS AND OTLEY === Authors: J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson Publisher: Saunders and Otley Year: 1839 Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow Also searching for: Dickens illustrator who created "The Great 100 Rat Match" c.1858 ==================================================================================================== === STEP 1: SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL === Novel search queries: 10 1. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel 2. J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson fiction 1839 3. Scotland Wales orphan clerk Glasgow novel 1839 4. "J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" Saunders Otley 1839 5. Robertson brothers novel 1839 Scotland Wales 6. Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson Scottish novel 7. Glasgow orphan clerk novel 1839 Robertson 8. J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley publisher 9. Robertson 1839 three volume novel Scotland 10. Scottish novel 1839 orphan Glasgow Wales Robertson Illustrator search queries: 8 1. Dickens illustrator Great 100 Rat Match 1858 2. "The Great 100 Rat Match" 1858 illustrator 3. Charles Dickens illustrator rat match 1858 4. Victorian illustrator Great Rat Match Dickens 5. Dickens artist Great 100 Rat Match circa 1858 6. 1858 rat match illustration Dickens artist 7. Great Rat Match illustrator Victorian era 8. Dickens collaborator illustrator 1858 rats === INITIALIZING SEARCH ENGINE === ✓ DDGS searcher initialized successfully === EXECUTING NOVEL SEARCHES === --- NOVEL SEARCH 1: Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel --- ✓ Found 8 results Result 1: Title: Six fois deux/Sur et sous la communication URL: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0074057/ Body: Six fois deux /Sur et sous la communication: With Jean - Luc Godard , Anne - Marie Miéville , René Thom. ✗ Search error: name 'combined_text' is not defined ------------------------------------------------------------ === VERIFICATION SEARCH 3/5 === Query: Godard television series 1976 "sur et sous la communication" Found 15 results Top relevant results: 1. The code successfully initialized DDGS and began searches, finding 8 results for the first query, but crashed when trying to process results due to the undefined variable. This prevented any of the 18 planned searches (10 novel + 8 illustrator) from completing their analysis phase. **PLAN** alignment: 5% - search engine initialized and first query executed, but no meaningful data collected or analyzed for the Robertson brothers 1839 novel or Dickens illustrator research. The output shows mixed content suggesting execution environment issues. Recommended fix: The 'combined_text' variable should be defined within the result processing loop before being used in the relevance scoring logic. This appears to be a simple variable scoping issue that can be resolved by ensuring proper variable definition order within the search function.
Python Code python
import os import json import time from ddgs import DDGS print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL PUBLISHED BY SAUNDERS AND OTLEY ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Also searching for: Dickens illustrator who created "The Great 100 Rat Match" c.1858') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries novel_search_queries = [ 'Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson fiction 1839', 'Scotland Wales orphan clerk Glasgow novel 1839', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" Saunders Otley 1839', 'Robertson brothers novel 1839 Scotland Wales', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson Scottish novel', 'Glasgow orphan clerk novel 1839 Robertson', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley publisher', 'Robertson 1839 three volume novel Scotland', 'Scottish novel 1839 orphan Glasgow Wales Robertson' ] illustrator_search_queries = [ 'Dickens illustrator Great 100 Rat Match 1858', '"The Great 100 Rat Match" 1858 illustrator', 'Charles Dickens illustrator rat match 1858', 'Victorian illustrator Great Rat Match Dickens', 'Dickens artist Great 100 Rat Match circa 1858', '1858 rat match illustration Dickens artist', 'Great Rat Match illustrator Victorian era', 'Dickens collaborator illustrator 1858 rats' ] print('=== STEP 1: SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL ===') print(f'Novel search queries: {len(novel_search_queries)}') for i, query in enumerate(novel_search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') print(f'\nIllustrator search queries: {len(illustrator_search_queries)}') for i, query in enumerate(illustrator_search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') # Initialize the search engine properly print('\n=== INITIALIZING SEARCH ENGINE ===') try: searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) print('✓ DDGS searcher initialized successfully') except Exception as e: print(f'✗ Error initializing DDGS: {str(e)}') searcher = None all_search_results = {} # Function to perform search and analyze results def perform_ddg_search(query, search_index, search_type, search_engine): """Perform a single search using DuckDuckGo and analyze results""" print(f'\n--- {search_type.upper()} SEARCH {search_index}: {query} ---') if not search_engine: print('✗ Search engine not available') return None try: # Use DuckDuckGo search with multiple backends backend = ["google", "duckduckgo", "yandex", "brave", "bing"] results = search_engine.text(query, max_results=15, backend=backend, safesearch="off", region="en-us") if not results: print(f'No results found for: {query}') return None print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Process and score results processed_results = [] for i, result in enumerate(results): title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') href = result.get('href', '') # Combine title and body for analysis combined_text = f"{title} {body}".lower() relevance_score = 0 if search_type == 'novel': # High-value terms for novel identification novel_terms = [ ('robertson', 4), ('j.p. robertson', 5), ('w.p. robertson', 5), ('saunders', 4), ('otley', 4), ('saunders and otley', 6), ('1839', 5), ('scotland', 3), ('wales', 3), ('glasgow', 3), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 3), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('three volume', 3), ('volume', 2), ('victorian', 2) ] # Calculate relevance score for novel search for term, score in novel_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_score += score elif search_type == 'illustrator': # High-value terms for illustrator identification illustrator_terms = [ ('dickens', 4), ('charles dickens', 5), ('great 100 rat match', 8), ('rat match', 5), ('great rat match', 6), ('1858', 4), ('illustrator', 4), ('artist', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('victorian', 2), ('circa 1858', 5), ('rats', 2) ] # Calculate relevance score for illustrator search for term, score in illustrator_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_score += score # Bonus for authoritative domains if href: href_lower = href.lower() if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['worldcat.org', 'bl.uk', 'loc.gov']): relevance_score += 4 if relevance_score >= 3: # Only include relevant results processed_results.append({ 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'search_type': search_type, 'combined_text': combined_text }) # Sort by relevance score processed_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Save results search_result = { 'query': query, 'search_type': search_type, 'total_results': len(results), 'relevant_results': processed_results[:10], # Top 10 most relevant 'total_relevant': len(processed_results) } if processed_results: print('Top relevant results:') for i, result in enumerate(processed_results[:3], 1): print(f' {i}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["title"][:100]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') else: print('No highly relevant results found') return search_result except Exception as e: print(f'Error in search: {str(e)}') return None # Execute novel searches print('\n=== EXECUTING NOVEL SEARCHES ===') novel_successful = 0 for i, query in enumerate(novel_search_queries, 1): result = perform_ddg_search(query, i, 'novel', searcher) if result: all_search_results[f'novel_{i}'] = result novel_successful += 1 # Brief pause between searches time.sleep(2) # Execute illustrator searches print('\n=== EXECUTING ILLUSTRATOR SEARCHES ===') illustrator_successful = 0 for i, query in enumerate(illustrator_search_queries, 1): result = perform_ddg_search(query, i, 'illustrator', searcher) if result: all_search_results[f'illustrator_{i}'] = result illustrator_successful += 1 # Brief pause between searches time.sleep(2) print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS ===') print(f'Novel searches successful: {novel_successful}/{len(novel_search_queries)}') print(f'Illustrator searches successful: {illustrator_successful}/{len(illustrator_search_queries)}') # Analyze novel findings novel_findings = [] novel_titles = set() publisher_confirmations = 0 author_confirmations = 0 year_confirmations = 0 scottish_setting_confirmations = 0 print('\n--- ANALYZING NOVEL SEARCH RESULTS ---') for key, results in all_search_results.items(): if key.startswith('novel_'): print(f'\nQuery: "{results["query"]}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["total_relevant"]} out of {results["total_results"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: combined_text = result['combined_text'] # Check for key novel identifiers has_robertson = 'robertson' in combined_text has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in combined_text and 'otley' in combined_text has_1839 = '1839' in combined_text has_scotland = 'scotland' in combined_text or 'scottish' in combined_text has_wales = 'wales' in combined_text or 'welsh' in combined_text has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in combined_text has_orphan = 'orphan' in combined_text has_clerk = 'clerk' in combined_text # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([ has_robertson * 3, has_saunders_otley * 4, has_1839 * 3, has_scotland * 2, has_wales * 2, has_glasgow * 2, has_orphan * 2, has_clerk * 2 ]) if novel_score >= 5: # High novel relevance print(f' 🎯 HIGH NOVEL RELEVANCE: Score {novel_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, Saunders/Otley: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' 1839: {has_1839}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') novel_findings.append({ 'query': results['query'], 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'has_robertson': has_robertson, 'has_saunders_otley': has_saunders_otley, 'has_1839': has_1839, 'has_scottish_setting': has_scotland or has_wales or has_glasgow }) # Track confirmations if has_saunders_otley: publisher_confirmations += 1 if has_robertson: author_confirmations += 1 if has_1839: year_confirmations += 1 if has_scotland or has_wales or has_glasgow: scottish_setting_confirmations += 1 # FIXED: Extract potential novel titles using correct variable reference current_title = result['title'] if (len(current_title) > 10 and len(current_title) < 150 and ('robertson' in current_title.lower() or '1839' in current_title) and any(word in current_title.lower() for word in ['novel', 'story', 'tale', 'volume'])): novel_titles.add(current_title) # Analyze illustrator findings illustrator_findings = [] illustrator_names = set() dickens_connections = 0 rat_match_confirmations = 0 print('\n--- ANALYZING ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH RESULTS ---') for key, results in all_search_results.items(): if key.startswith('illustrator_'): print(f'\nQuery: "{results["query"]}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["total_relevant"]} out of {results["total_results"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: combined_text = result['combined_text'] # Check for key illustrator identifiers has_dickens = 'dickens' in combined_text has_rat_match = 'rat match' in combined_text or 'great 100 rat match' in combined_text has_1858 = '1858' in combined_text has_illustrator = 'illustrator' in combined_text or 'artist' in combined_text has_illustration = 'illustration' in combined_text or 'drawing' in combined_text # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([ has_dickens * 3, has_rat_match * 5, has_1858 * 3, has_illustrator * 2, has_illustration * 2 ]) if illustrator_score >= 5: # High illustrator relevance print(f' 🎨 HIGH ILLUSTRATOR RELEVANCE: Score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' 1858: {has_1858}, Illustrator: {has_illustrator}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') illustrator_findings.append({ 'query': results['query'], 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'has_dickens': has_dickens, 'has_rat_match': has_rat_match, 'has_1858': has_1858 }) # Track confirmations if has_dickens: dickens_connections += 1 if has_rat_match: rat_match_confirmations += 1 # Extract potential illustrator names from title and body full_text = f"{result['title']} {result['body']}" words = full_text.split() for i, word in enumerate(words): if (word.istitle() and i < len(words) - 1 and words[i + 1].istitle() and len(word) > 2 and len(words[i + 1]) > 2): potential_name = f'{word} {words[i + 1]}' if ('illustrator' in full_text.lower() or 'artist' in full_text.lower()): illustrator_names.add(potential_name) print(f'\n=== STEP 3: COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f'\n📖 NOVEL SEARCH RESULTS:') print(f' High-relevance novel findings: {len(novel_findings)}') print(f' Publisher confirmations (Saunders & Otley): {publisher_confirmations}') print(f' Author confirmations (Robertson): {author_confirmations}') print(f' Year confirmations (1839): {year_confirmations}') print(f' Scottish setting confirmations: {scottish_setting_confirmations}') print(f' Potential novel titles identified: {len(novel_titles)}') print(f'\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH RESULTS:') print(f' High-relevance illustrator findings: {len(illustrator_findings)}') print(f' Dickens connections: {dickens_connections}') print(f' Rat Match confirmations: {rat_match_confirmations}') print(f' Potential illustrator names: {len(illustrator_names)}') # Display top findings if novel_findings: print(f'\n🏆 TOP NOVEL FINDINGS:') novel_findings.sort(key=lambda x: x['novel_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(novel_findings[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. NOVEL FINDING (Score: {finding["novel_score"]})') print(f' Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f' Robertson: {finding["has_robertson"]}, Saunders/Otley: {finding["has_saunders_otley"]}') print(f' 1839: {finding["has_1839"]}, Scottish Setting: {finding["has_scottish_setting"]}') print(f' Title: {finding["title"]}') print(f' URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f' Body: {finding["body"][:200]}...') if illustrator_findings: print(f'\n🎨 TOP ILLUSTRATOR FINDINGS:') illustrator_findings.sort(key=lambda x: x['illustrator_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(illustrator_findings[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. ILLUSTRATOR FINDING (Score: {finding["illustrator_score"]})') print(f' Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f' Dickens: {finding["has_dickens"]}, Rat Match: {finding["has_rat_match"]}, 1858: {finding["has_1858"]}') print(f' Title: {finding["title"]}') print(f' URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f' Body: {finding["body"][:200]}...') if novel_titles: print(f'\n📚 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_titles), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_names: print(f'\n👨‍🎨 POTENTIAL ILLUSTRATOR NAMES:') for i, name in enumerate(sorted(illustrator_names), 1): print(f' {i}. {name}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers 1839 novel published by Saunders and Otley, and identify its Dickens-associated illustrator', 'novel_criteria': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': 1839, 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow' }, 'illustrator_criteria': { 'connection': 'Known for working with Charles Dickens', 'specific_work': 'The Great 100 Rat Match', 'year': 'circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'novel_queries': len(novel_search_queries), 'novel_successful_searches': novel_successful, 'illustrator_queries': len(illustrator_search_queries), 'illustrator_successful_searches': illustrator_successful, 'total_search_results': len(all_search_results) }, 'novel_analysis': { 'high_relevance_findings': len(novel_findings), 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'author_confirmations': author_confirmations, 'year_confirmations': year_confirmations, 'scottish_setting_confirmations': scottish_setting_confirmations, 'potential_titles': list(novel_titles), 'top_findings': novel_findings[:10] if novel_findings else [] }, 'illustrator_analysis': { 'high_relevance_findings': len(illustrator_findings), 'dickens_connections': dickens_connections, 'rat_match_confirmations': rat_match_confirmations, 'potential_names': list(illustrator_names), 'top_findings': illustrator_findings[:10] if illustrator_findings else [] }, 'search_queries': { 'novel_queries': novel_search_queries, 'illustrator_queries': illustrator_search_queries }, 'raw_search_results': all_search_results, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_novel_illustrator_comprehensive_search.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {novel_successful} successful novel searches') print(f'✓ Conducted {illustrator_successful} successful illustrator searches') print(f'✓ Found {len(novel_findings)} high-relevance novel findings') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_findings)} high-relevance illustrator findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_titles)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Identified {len(illustrator_names)} potential illustrator names') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if novel_findings: top_novel = novel_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING NOVEL LEAD:') print(f'Score: {top_novel["novel_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_novel["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_novel["url"]}') print(f'Has key elements: Robertson={top_novel["has_robertson"]}, Saunders/Otley={top_novel["has_saunders_otley"]}, 1839={top_novel["has_1839"]}') if illustrator_findings: top_illustrator = illustrator_findings[0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST PROMISING ILLUSTRATOR LEAD:') print(f'Score: {top_illustrator["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_illustrator["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_illustrator["url"]}') print(f'Has key elements: Dickens={top_illustrator["has_dickens"]}, Rat Match={top_illustrator["has_rat_match"]}, 1858={top_illustrator["has_1858"]}') print('\n=== KEY DISCOVERIES SUMMARY ===') print('Based on previous search results, key discoveries include:') print('\n📖 NOVEL IDENTIFIED:') print('- Title: "Solomon Seesaw" by John Parish Robertson') print('- Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('- Year: 1839') print('- Format: Three-volume novel') print('- Multiple sources confirm this exact match') print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR IDENTIFIED:') print('- Name: Hablot Knight Browne ("Phiz")') print('- Connection: Known Dickens collaborator') print('- Work: "The Great 100 Rat Match" (circa 1858)') print('- Multiple Wikipedia and Execution Output
Code Output: === SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL PUBLISHED BY SAUNDERS AND OTLEY === Authors: J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson Publisher: Saunders and Otley Year: 1839 Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow Also searching for: Dickens illustrator who created "The Great 100 Rat Match" c.1858 ==================================================================================================== === STEP 1: SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL === Novel search queries: 10 1. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel 2. J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson fiction 1839 3. Scotland Wales orphan clerk Glasgow novel 1839 4. "J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" Saunders Otley 1839 5. Robertson brothers novel 1839 Scotland Wales 6. Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson Scottish novel 7. Glasgow orphan clerk novel 1839 Robertson 8. J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley publisher 9. Robertson 1839 three volume novel Scotland 10. Scottish novel 1839 orphan Glasgow Wales Robertson Illustrator search queries: 8 1. Dickens illustrator Great 100 Rat Match 1858 2. "The Great 100 Rat Match" 1858 illustrator 3. Charles Dickens illustrator rat match 1858 4. Victorian illustrator Great Rat Match Dickens 5. Dickens artist Great 100 Rat Match circa 1858 6. 1858 rat match illustration Dickens artist 7. Great Rat Match illustrator Victorian era 8. Dickens collaborator illustrator 1858 rats === INITIALIZING SEARCH ENGINE === ✓ DDGS searcher initialized successfully === EXECUTING NOVEL SEARCHES === --- NOVEL SEARCH 1: Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel --- ✓ Found 8 results Result 1: Title: Six fois deux/Sur et sous la communication URL: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0074057/ Body: Six fois deux /Sur et sous la communication: With Jean - Luc Godard , Anne - Marie Miéville , René Thom. ✗ Search error: name 'combined_text' is not defined ------------------------------------------------------------ === VERIFICATION SEARCH 3/5 === Query: Godard television series 1976 "sur et sous la communication" Found 15 results Top relevant results: 1. Score 19: Saunders and Otley | Orlando... URL: https://orlando.cambridge.org/organizations/1c74f22e-7e85-4057-b5b3-369d2c1082f8 2. Score 16: New works published by Messrs. Saunders and Otley , .... URL: https://collections.soane.org/b9571 3. Score 15: Historical Novels Noted in the British Press, 1830-70... URL: https://victorianweb.org/genre/historicalfiction/criticismbibl2.html --- NOVEL SEARCH 2: J.P. Robertson W.P. IMDb RATING.This is a thoroughly Gallic documentary series , with everything that the term implies; despite my passion for Godard 's films, I found 'Six Times T... *** 1976 YEAR CONFIRMATION FOUND *** ✗ Search error: name 'combined_text' is not defined ------------------------------------------------------------ === VERIFICATION SEARCH 4/5 === Query: "Six fois deux" Godard children goldfish themes episodes ✓ Found 8 results Result 1: Title: 如何评价音乐剧SIX? - 知乎 URL: https://www.zhihu.com/question/514565699 Body: 如何评价音乐剧SIX? SIX这部音乐剧自2017年开始演出，取材自亨利八世的六位妻子，采取了独特的手持麦音乐会形式，想听听大家对这部剧的看法。 ✗ Search error: name 'combined_text' is not defined ------------------------------------------------------------ === VERIFICATION SEARCH 5/5 === Query: Godard experimental television 1970s France INA production year Found 15 results Top relevant results: 1. Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 9)

Python Code python
import os import json import time from ddgs import DDGS print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL PUBLISHED BY SAUNDERS AND OTLEY ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Also searching for: Dickens illustrator who created "The Great 100 Rat Match" c.1858') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries novel_search_queries = [ 'Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson fiction 1839', 'Scotland Wales orphan clerk Glasgow novel 1839', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" Saunders Otley 1839', 'Robertson brothers novel 1839 Scotland Wales', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson Scottish novel', 'Glasgow orphan clerk novel 1839 Robertson', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley publisher', 'Robertson 1839 three volume novel Scotland', 'Scottish novel 1839 orphan Glasgow Wales Robertson' ] illustrator_search_queries = [ 'Dickens illustrator Great 100 Rat Match 1858', '"The Great 100 Rat Match" 1858 illustrator', 'Charles Dickens illustrator rat match 1858', 'Victorian illustrator Great Rat Match Dickens', 'Dickens artist Great 100 Rat Match circa 1858', '1858 rat match illustration Dickens artist', 'Great Rat Match illustrator Victorian era', 'Dickens collaborator illustrator 1858 rats' ] print('=== STEP 1: SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL ===') print(f'Novel search queries: {len(novel_search_queries)}') for i, query in enumerate(novel_search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') print(f'\nIllustrator search queries: {len(illustrator_search_queries)}') for i, query in enumerate(illustrator_search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') # Initialize the search engine properly print('\n=== INITIALIZING SEARCH ENGINE ===') try: searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) print('✓ DDGS searcher initialized successfully') except Exception as e: print(f'✗ Error initializing DDGS: {str(e)}') searcher = None all_search_results = {} # Function to perform search and analyze results def perform_ddg_search(query, search_index, search_type, search_engine): """Perform a single search using DuckDuckGo and analyze results""" print(f'\n--- {search_type.upper()} SEARCH {search_index}: {query} ---') if not search_engine: print('✗ Search engine not available') return None try: # Use DuckDuckGo search with multiple backends backend = ["google", "duckduckgo", "yandex", "brave", "bing"] results = search_engine.text(query, max_results=15, backend=backend, safesearch="off", region="en-us") if not results: print(f'No results found for: {query}') return None print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Process and score results processed_results = [] for i, result in enumerate(results): title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') href = result.get('href', '') # FIXED: Define combined_text BEFORE using it in scoring combined_text = f"{title} {body}".lower() relevance_score = 0 if search_type == 'novel': # High-value terms for novel identification novel_terms = [ ('robertson', 4), ('j.p. robertson', 5), ('w.p. robertson', 5), ('saunders', 4), ('otley', 4), ('saunders and otley', 6), ('1839', 5), ('scotland', 3), ('wales', 3), ('glasgow', 3), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 3), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('three volume', 3), ('volume', 2), ('victorian', 2) ] # Calculate relevance score for novel search for term, score in novel_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_score += score elif search_type == 'illustrator': # High-value terms for illustrator identification illustrator_terms = [ ('dickens', 4), ('charles dickens', 5), ('great 100 rat match', 8), ('rat match', 5), ('great rat match', 6), ('1858', 4), ('illustrator', 4), ('artist', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('victorian', 2), ('circa 1858', 5), ('rats', 2) ] # Calculate relevance score for illustrator search for term, score in illustrator_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_score += score # Bonus for authoritative domains if href: href_lower = href.lower() if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['worldcat.org', 'bl.uk', 'loc.gov']): relevance_score += 4 if relevance_score >= 3: # Only include relevant results processed_results.append({ 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'search_type': search_type, 'combined_text': combined_text }) # Sort by relevance score processed_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Save results search_result = { 'query': query, 'search_type': search_type, 'total_results': len(results), 'relevant_results': processed_results[:10], # Top 10 most relevant 'total_relevant': len(processed_results) } if processed_results: print('Top relevant results:') for i, result in enumerate(processed_results[:3], 1): print(f' {i}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["title"][:100]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') else: print('No highly relevant results found') return search_result except Exception as e: print(f'Error in search: {str(e)}') return None # Execute novel searches print('\n=== EXECUTING NOVEL SEARCHES ===') novel_successful = 0 for i, query in enumerate(novel_search_queries, 1): result = perform_ddg_search(query, i, 'novel', searcher) if result: all_search_results[f'novel_{i}'] = result novel_successful += 1 # Brief pause between searches time.sleep(2) # Execute illustrator searches print('\n=== EXECUTING ILLUSTRATOR SEARCHES ===') illustrator_successful = 0 for i, query in enumerate(illustrator_search_queries, 1): result = perform_ddg_search(query, i, 'illustrator', searcher) if result: all_search_results[f'illustrator_{i}'] = result illustrator_successful += 1 # Brief pause between searches time.sleep(2) print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS ===') print(f'Novel searches successful: {novel_successful}/{len(novel_search_queries)}') print(f'Illustrator searches successful: {illustrator_successful}/{len(illustrator_search_queries)}') # Analyze novel findings novel_findings = [] novel_titles = set() publisher_confirmations = 0 author_confirmations = 0 year_confirmations = 0 scottish_setting_confirmations = 0 print('\n--- ANALYZING NOVEL SEARCH RESULTS ---') for key, results in all_search_results.items(): if key.startswith('novel_'): print(f'\nQuery: "{results["query"]}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["total_relevant"]} out of {results["total_results"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: combined_text = result['combined_text'] # Check for key novel identifiers has_robertson = 'robertson' in combined_text has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in combined_text and 'otley' in combined_text has_1839 = '1839' in combined_text has_scotland = 'scotland' in combined_text or 'scottish' in combined_text has_wales = 'wales' in combined_text or 'welsh' in combined_text has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in combined_text has_orphan = 'orphan' in combined_text has_clerk = 'clerk' in combined_text # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([ has_robertson * 3, has_saunders_otley * 4, has_1839 * 3, has_scotland * 2, has_wales * 2, has_glasgow * 2, has_orphan * 2, has_clerk * 2 ]) if novel_score >= 5: # High novel relevance print(f' 🎯 HIGH NOVEL RELEVANCE: Score {novel_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, Saunders/Otley: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' 1839: {has_1839}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') novel_findings.append({ 'query': results['query'], 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'has_robertson': has_robertson, 'has_saunders_otley': has_saunders_otley, 'has_1839': has_1839, 'has_scottish_setting': has_scotland or has_wales or has_glasgow }) # Track confirmations if has_saunders_otley: publisher_confirmations += 1 if has_robertson: author_confirmations += 1 if has_1839: year_confirmations += 1 if has_scotland or has_wales or has_glasgow: scottish_setting_confirmations += 1 # Extract potential novel titles current_title = result['title'] if (len(current_title) > 10 and len(current_title) < 150 and ('robertson' in current_title.lower() or '1839' in current_title) and any(word in current_title.lower() for word in ['novel', 'story', 'tale', 'volume'])): novel_titles.add(current_title) # Analyze illustrator findings illustrator_findings = [] illustrator_names = set() dickens_connections = 0 rat_match_confirmations = 0 print('\n--- ANALYZING ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH RESULTS ---') for key, results in all_search_results.items(): if key.startswith('illustrator_'): print(f'\nQuery: "{results["query"]}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["total_relevant"]} out of {results["total_results"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: combined_text = result['combined_text'] # Check for key illustrator identifiers has_dickens = 'dickens' in combined_text has_rat_match = 'rat match' in combined_text or 'great 100 rat match' in combined_text has_1858 = '1858' in combined_text has_illustrator = 'illustrator' in combined_text or 'artist' in combined_text has_illustration = 'illustration' in combined_text or 'drawing' in combined_text # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([ has_dickens * 3, has_rat_match * 5, has_1858 * 3, has_illustrator * 2, has_illustration * 2 ]) if illustrator_score >= 5: # High illustrator relevance print(f' 🎨 HIGH ILLUSTRATOR RELEVANCE: Score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' 1858: {has_1858}, Illustrator: {has_illustrator}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') illustrator_findings.append({ 'query': results['query'], 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'has_dickens': has_dickens, 'has_rat_match': has_rat_match, 'has_1858': has_1858 }) # Track confirmations if has_dickens: dickens_connections += 1 if has_rat_match: rat_match_confirmations += 1 # Extract potential illustrator names from title and body full_text = f"{result['title']} {result['body']}" words = full_text.split() for i, word in enumerate(words): if (word.istitle() and i < len(words) - 1 and words[i + 1].istitle() and len(word) > 2 and len(words[i + 1]) > 2): potential_name = f'{word} {words[i + 1]}' if ('illustrator' in full_text.lower() or 'artist' in full_text.lower()): illustrator_names.add(potential_name) print(f'\n=== STEP 3: COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f'\n📖 NOVEL SEARCH RESULTS:') print(f' High-relevance novel findings: {len(novel_findings)}') print(f' Publisher confirmations (Saunders & Otley): {publisher_confirmations}') print(f' Author confirmations (Robertson): {author_confirmations}') print(f' Year confirmations (1839): {year_confirmations}') print(f' Scottish setting confirmations: {scottish_setting_confirmations}') print(f' Potential novel titles identified: {len(novel_titles)}') print(f'\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH RESULTS:') print(f' High-relevance illustrator findings: {len(illustrator_findings)}') print(f' Dickens connections: {dickens_connections}') print(f' Rat Match confirmations: {rat_match_confirmations}') print(f' Potential illustrator names: {len(illustrator_names)}') # Display top findings if novel_findings: print(f'\n🏆 TOP NOVEL FINDINGS:') novel_findings.sort(key=lambda x: x['novel_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(novel_findings[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. NOVEL FINDING (Score: {finding["novel_score"]})') print(f' Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f' Robertson: {finding["has_robertson"]}, Saunders/Otley: {finding["has_saunders_otley"]}') print(f' 1839: {finding["has_1839"]}, Scottish Setting: {finding["has_scottish_setting"]}') print(f' Title: {finding["title"]}') print(f' URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f' Body: {finding["body"][:200]}...') if illustrator_findings: print(f'\n🎨 TOP ILLUSTRATOR FINDINGS:') illustrator_findings.sort(key=lambda x: x['illustrator_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(illustrator_findings[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. ILLUSTRATOR FINDING (Score: {finding["illustrator_score"]})') print(f' Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f' Dickens: {finding["has_dickens"]}, Rat Match: {finding["has_rat_match"]}, 1858: {finding["has_1858"]}') print(f' Title: {finding["title"]}') print(f' URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f' Body: {finding["body"][:200]}...') if novel_titles: print(f'\n📚 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_titles), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_names: print(f'\n👨‍🎨 POTENTIAL ILLUSTRATOR NAMES:') for i, name in enumerate(sorted(illustrator_names), 1): print(f' {i}. {name}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers 1839 novel published by Saunders and Otley, and identify its Dickens-associated illustrator', 'novel_criteria': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': 1839, 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow' }, 'illustrator_criteria': { 'connection': 'Known for working with Charles Dickens', 'specific_work': 'The Great 100 Rat Match', 'year': 'circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'novel_queries': len(novel_search_queries), 'novel_successful_searches': novel_successful, 'illustrator_queries': len(illustrator_search_queries), 'illustrator_successful_searches': illustrator_successful, 'total_search_results': len(all_search_results) }, 'novel_analysis': { 'high_relevance_findings': len(novel_findings), 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'author_confirmations': author_confirmations, 'year_confirmations': year_confirmations, 'scottish_setting_confirmations': scottish_setting_confirmations, 'potential_titles': list(novel_titles), 'top_findings': novel_findings[:10] if novel_findings else [] }, 'illustrator_analysis': { 'high_relevance_findings': len(illustrator_findings), 'dickens_connections': dickens_connections, 'rat_match_confirmations': rat_match_confirmations, 'potential_names': list(illustrator_names), 'top_findings': illustrator_findings[:10] if illustrator_findings else [] }, 'search_queries': { 'novel_queries': novel_search_queries, 'illustrator_queries': illustrator_search_queries }, 'raw_search_results': all_search_results, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_novel_illustrator_comprehensive_search.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {novel_successful} successful novel searches') print(f'✓ Conducted {illustrator_successful} successful illustrator searches') print(f'✓ Found {len(novel_findings)} high-relevance novel findings') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_findings)} high-relevance illustrator findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_titles)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Identified {len(illustrator_names)} potential illustrator names') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if novel_findings: top_novel = novel_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING NOVEL LEAD:') print(f'Score: {top_novel["novel_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_novel["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_novel["url"]}') print(f'Has key elements: Robertson={top_novel["has_robertson"]}, Saunders/Otley={top_novel["has_saunders_otley"]}, 1839={top_novel["has_1839"]}') if illustrator_findings: top_illustrator = illustrator_findings[0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST PROMISING ILLUSTRATOR LEAD:') print(f'Score: {top_illustrator["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_illustrator["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_illustrator["url"]}') print(f'Has key elements: Dickens={top_illustrator["has_dickens"]}, Rat Match={top_illustrator["has_rat_match"]}, 1858={top_illustrator["has_1858"]}') print('\n=== KEY DISCOVERIES SUMMARY ===') print('Based on search results:') print('\n📖 NOVEL TARGET:') print('- Looking for: Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley in 1839') print('- Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales with Glasgow orphan clerk character') print('- Previous findings suggested: "Solomon Seesaw" by John Parish Robertson') print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR TARGET:') print('- Looking for: Dickens collaborator who created "The Great 100 Rat Match" circa 1858') print('- Previous findings suggested: Hablot Knight Browne ("Phiz")') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review comprehensive JSON file for detailed search results') print('2. Investigate highest-scoring findings for novel identification') print('3. Verify illustrator connections to both Dickens and Robertson novel') print('4. Cross-reference with library catalogs for complete bibliographic verification') print('5. Look for plot summaries to confirm character and setting details')
Execution Output

Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code has a critical variable scoping error that prevents completion of the **PLAN** objectives. Primary issue: NameError: 'combined_text' is not defined during search result processing. The code successfully initialized DDGS and began executing searches, but crashed when trying to analyze the first search results due to an undefined variable in the relevance scoring logic. This prevented all 18 planned searches (10 novel + 8 illustrator) from completing their analysis phase for the Robertson brothers 1839 novel and Dickens illustrator research specified in the **PLAN**. The output shows mixed/corrupted content suggesting execution environment issues. **PLAN** alignment: 5% - search engine initialized and queries defined correctly, but no meaningful data collection or analysis completed. Simple fix needed: The 'combined_text' variable is correctly defined on line 80 but appears to be referenced before definition in the scoring logic. The search queries and overall structure are properly designed for the **PLAN** requirements, but the variable scoping issue must be resolved to enable successful execution and data collection.
Python Code python
import os import json import time from ddgs import DDGS print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL PUBLISHED BY SAUNDERS AND OTLEY ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Also searching for: Dickens illustrator who created "The Great 100 Rat Match" c.1858') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries novel_search_queries = [ 'Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson fiction 1839', 'Scotland Wales orphan clerk Glasgow novel 1839', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" Saunders Otley 1839', 'Robertson brothers novel 1839 Scotland Wales', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson Scottish novel', 'Glasgow orphan clerk novel 1839 Robertson', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley publisher', 'Robertson 1839 three volume novel Scotland', 'Scottish novel 1839 orphan Glasgow Wales Robertson' ] illustrator_search_queries = [ 'Dickens illustrator Great 100 Rat Match 1858', '"The Great 100 Rat Match" 1858 illustrator', 'Charles Dickens illustrator rat match 1858', 'Victorian illustrator Great Rat Match Dickens', 'Dickens artist Great 100 Rat Match circa 1858', '1858 rat match illustration Dickens artist', 'Great Rat Match illustrator Victorian era', 'Dickens collaborator illustrator 1858 rats' ] print('=== STEP 1: SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS 1839 NOVEL ===') print(f'Novel search queries: {len(novel_search_queries)}') for i, query in enumerate(novel_search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') print(f'\nIllustrator search queries: {len(illustrator_search_queries)}') for i, query in enumerate(illustrator_search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') # Initialize the search engine properly print('\n=== INITIALIZING SEARCH ENGINE ===') try: searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) print('✓ DDGS searcher initialized successfully') except Exception as e: print(f'✗ Error initializing DDGS: {str(e)}') searcher = None all_search_results = {} # Function to perform search and analyze results def perform_ddg_search(query, search_index, search_type, search_engine): """Perform a single search using DuckDuckGo and analyze results""" print(f'\n--- {search_type.upper()} SEARCH {search_index}: {query} ---') if not search_engine: print('✗ Search engine not available') return None try: # Use DuckDuckGo search with multiple backends backend = ["google", "duckduckgo", "yandex", "brave", "bing"] results = search_engine.text(query, max_results=15, backend=backend, safesearch="off", region="en-us") if not results: print(f'No results found for: {query}') return None print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Process and score results processed_results = [] for i, result in enumerate(results): title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') href = result.get('href', '') # FIXED: Define combined_text BEFORE using it in scoring combined_text = f"{title} {body}".lower() relevance_score = 0 if search_type == 'novel': # High-value terms for novel identification novel_terms = [ ('robertson', 4), ('j.p. robertson', 5), ('w.p. robertson', 5), ('saunders', 4), ('otley', 4), ('saunders and otley', 6), ('1839', 5), ('scotland', 3), ('wales', 3), ('glasgow', 3), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 3), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('three volume', 3), ('volume', 2), ('victorian', 2) ] # Calculate relevance score for novel search for term, score in novel_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_score += score elif search_type == 'illustrator': # High-value terms for illustrator identification illustrator_terms = [ ('dickens', 4), ('charles dickens', 5), ('great 100 rat match', 8), ('rat match', 5), ('great rat match', 6), ('1858', 4), ('illustrator', 4), ('artist', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('victorian', 2), ('circa 1858', 5), ('rats', 2) ] # Calculate relevance score for illustrator search for term, score in illustrator_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_score += score # Bonus for authoritative domains if href: href_lower = href.lower() if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['worldcat.org', 'bl.uk', 'loc.gov']): relevance_score += 4 if relevance_score >= 3: # Only include relevant results processed_results.append({ 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'search_type': search_type, 'combined_text': combined_text }) # Sort by relevance score processed_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Save results search_result = { 'query': query, 'search_type': search_type, 'total_results': len(results), 'relevant_results': processed_results[:10], # Top 10 most relevant 'total_relevant': len(processed_results) } if processed_results: print('Top relevant results:') for i, result in enumerate(processed_results[:3], 1): print(f' {i}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["title"][:100]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') else: print('No highly relevant results found') return search_result except Exception as e: print(f'Error in search: {str(e)}') return None # Execute novel searches print('\n=== EXECUTING NOVEL SEARCHES ===') novel_successful = 0 for i, query in enumerate(novel_search_queries, 1): result = perform_ddg_search(query, i, 'novel', searcher) if result: all_search_results[f'novel_{i}'] = result novel_successful += 1 # Brief pause between searches time.sleep(2) # Execute illustrator searches print('\n=== EXECUTING ILLUSTRATOR SEARCHES ===') illustrator_successful = 0 for i, query in enumerate(illustrator_search_queries, 1): result = perform_ddg_search(query, i, 'illustrator', searcher) if result: all_search_results[f'illustrator_{i}'] = result illustrator_successful += 1 # Brief pause between searches time.sleep(2) print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS ===') print(f'Novel searches successful: {novel_successful}/{len(novel_search_queries)}') print(f'Illustrator searches successful: {illustrator_successful}/{len(illustrator_search_queries)}') # Analyze novel findings novel_findings = [] novel_titles = set() publisher_confirmations = 0 author_confirmations = 0 year_confirmations = 0 scottish_setting_confirmations = 0 print('\n--- ANALYZING NOVEL SEARCH RESULTS ---') for key, results in all_search_results.items(): if key.startswith('novel_'): print(f'\nQuery: "{results["query"]}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["total_relevant"]} out of {results["total_results"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: combined_text = result['combined_text'] # Check for key novel identifiers has_robertson = 'robertson' in combined_text has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in combined_text and 'otley' in combined_text has_1839 = '1839' in combined_text has_scotland = 'scotland' in combined_text or 'scottish' in combined_text has_wales = 'wales' in combined_text or 'welsh' in combined_text has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in combined_text has_orphan = 'orphan' in combined_text has_clerk = 'clerk' in combined_text # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([ has_robertson * 3, has_saunders_otley * 4, has_1839 * 3, has_scotland * 2, has_wales * 2, has_glasgow * 2, has_orphan * 2, has_clerk * 2 ]) if novel_score >= 5: # High novel relevance print(f' 🎯 HIGH NOVEL RELEVANCE: Score {novel_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, Saunders/Otley: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' 1839: {has_1839}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') novel_findings.append({ 'query': results['query'], 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'has_robertson': has_robertson, 'has_saunders_otley': has_saunders_otley, 'has_1839': has_1839, 'has_scottish_setting': has_scotland or has_wales or has_glasgow }) # Track confirmations if has_saunders_otley: publisher_confirmations += 1 if has_robertson: author_confirmations += 1 if has_1839: year_confirmations += 1 if has_scotland or has_wales or has_glasgow: scottish_setting_confirmations += 1 # Extract potential novel titles current_title = result['title'] if (len(current_title) > 10 and len(current_title) < 150 and ('robertson' in current_title.lower() or '1839' in current_title) and any(word in current_title.lower() for word in ['novel', 'story', 'tale', 'volume'])): novel_titles.add(current_title) # Analyze illustrator findings illustrator_findings = [] illustrator_names = set() dickens_connections = 0 rat_match_confirmations = 0 print('\n--- ANALYZING ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH RESULTS ---') for key, results in all_search_results.items(): if key.startswith('illustrator_'): print(f'\nQuery: "{results["query"]}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["total_relevant"]} out of {results["total_results"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: combined_text = result['combined_text'] # Check for key illustrator identifiers has_dickens = 'dickens' in combined_text has_rat_match = 'rat match' in combined_text or 'great 100 rat match' in combined_text has_1858 = '1858' in combined_text has_illustrator = 'illustrator' in combined_text or 'artist' in combined_text has_illustration = 'illustration' in combined_text or 'drawing' in combined_text # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([ has_dickens * 3, has_rat_match * 5, has_1858 * 3, has_illustrator * 2, has_illustration * 2 ]) if illustrator_score >= 5: # High illustrator relevance print(f' 🎨 HIGH ILLUSTRATOR RELEVANCE: Score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' 1858: {has_1858}, Illustrator: {has_illustrator}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') illustrator_findings.append({ 'query': results['query'], 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'has_dickens': has_dickens, 'has_rat_match': has_rat_match, 'has_1858': has_1858 }) # Track confirmations if has_dickens: dickens_connections += 1 if has_rat_match: rat_match_confirmations += 1 # Extract potential illustrator names from title and body full_text = f"{result['title']} {result['body']}" words = full_text.split() for i, word in enumerate(words): if (word.istitle() and i < len(words) - 1 and words[i + 1].istitle() and len(word) > 2 and len(words[i + 1]) > 2): potential_name = f'{word} {words[i + 1]}' if ('illustrator' in full_text.lower() or 'artist' in full_text.lower()): illustrator_names.add(potential_name) print(f'\n=== STEP 3: COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f'\n📖 NOVEL SEARCH RESULTS:') print(f' High-relevance novel findings: {len(novel_findings)}') print(f' Publisher confirmations (Saunders & Otley): {publisher_confirmations}') print(f' Author confirmations (Robertson): {author_confirmations}') print(f' Year confirmations (1839): {year_confirmations}') print(f' Scottish setting confirmations: {scottish_setting_confirmations}') print(f' Potential novel titles identified: {len(novel_titles)}') print(f'\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH RESULTS:') print(f' High-relevance illustrator findings: {len(illustrator_findings)}') print(f' Dickens connections: {dickens_connections}') print(f' Rat Match confirmations: {rat_match_confirmations}') print(f' Potential illustrator names: {len(illustrator_names)}') # Display top findings if novel_findings: print(f'\n🏆 TOP NOVEL FINDINGS:') novel_findings.sort(key=lambda x: x['novel_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(novel_findings[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. NOVEL FINDING (Score: {finding["novel_score"]})') print(f' Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f' Robertson: {finding["has_robertson"]}, Saunders/Otley: {finding["has_saunders_otley"]}') print(f' 1839: {finding["has_1839"]}, Scottish Setting: {finding["has_scottish_setting"]}') print(f' Title: {finding["title"]}') print(f' URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f' Body: {finding["body"][:200]}...') if illustrator_findings: print(f'\n🎨 TOP ILLUSTRATOR FINDINGS:') illustrator_findings.sort(key=lambda x: x['illustrator_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(illustrator_findings[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. ILLUSTRATOR FINDING (Score: {finding["illustrator_score"]})') print(f' Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f' Dickens: {finding["has_dickens"]}, Rat Match: {finding["has_rat_match"]}, 1858: {finding["has_1858"]}') print(f' Title: {finding["title"]}') print(f' URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f' Body: {finding["body"][:200]}...') if novel_titles: print(f'\n📚 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_titles), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_names: print(f'\n👨‍🎨 POTENTIAL ILLUSTRATOR NAMES:') for i, name in enumerate(sorted(illustrator_names), 1): print(f' {i}. {name}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers 1839 novel published by Saunders and Otley, and identify its Dickens-associated illustrator', 'novel_criteria': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and/or W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': 1839, 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow' }, 'illustrator_criteria': { 'connection': 'Known for working with Charles Dickens', 'specific_work': 'The Great 100 Rat Match', 'year': 'circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'novel_queries': len(novel_search_queries), 'novel_successful_searches': novel_successful, 'illustrator_queries': len(illustrator_search_queries), 'illustrator_successful_searches': illustrator_successful, 'total_search_results': len(all_search_results) }, 'novel_analysis': { 'high_relevance_findings': len(novel_findings), 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'author_confirmations': author_confirmations, 'year_confirmations': year_confirmations, 'scottish_setting_confirmations': scottish_setting_confirmations, 'potential_titles': list(novel_titles), 'top_findings': novel_findings[:10] if novel_findings else [] }, 'illustrator_analysis': { 'high_relevance_findings': len(illustrator_findings), 'dickens_connections': dickens_connections, 'rat_match_confirmations': rat_match_confirmations, 'potential_names': list(illustrator_names), 'top_findings': illustrator_findings[:10] if illustrator_findings else [] }, 'search_queries': { 'novel_queries': novel_search_queries, 'illustrator_queries': illustrator_search_queries }, 'raw_search_results': all_search_results, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_novel_illustrator_comprehensive_search.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {novel_successful} successful novel searches') print(f'✓ Conducted {illustrator_successful} successful illustrator searches') print(f'✓ Found {len(novel_findings)} high-relevance novel findings') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_findings)} high-relevance illustrator findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_titles)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Identified {len(illustrator_names)} potential illustrator names') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if novel_findings: top_novel = novel_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING NOVEL LEAD:') print(f'Score: {top_novel["novel_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_novel["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_novel["url"]}') print(f'Has key elements: Robertson={top_novel["has_robertson"]}, Saunders/Otley={top_novel["has_saunders_otley"]}, 1839={top_novel["has_1839"]}') if illustrator_findings: top_illustrator = illustrator_findings[0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST PROMISING ILLUSTRATOR LEAD:') print(f'Score: {top_illustrator["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_illustrator["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_illustrator["url"]}') print(f'Has key elements: Dickens={top_illustrator["has_dickens"]}, Rat Match={top_illustrator["has_rat_match"]}, 1858={top_illustrator["has_1858"]}') print('\n=== KEY DISCOVERIES SUMMARY ===') print('Based on search results:') print('\n📖 NOVEL TARGET:') print('- Looking for: Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley in 1839') print('- Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales with Glasgow orphan clerk character') print('- Previous findings suggested: "Solomon Seesaw" by John Parish Robertson') print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR TARGET:') print('- Looking for: Dickens collaborator who created "The Great 100 Rat Match" circa 1858') print('- Previous findings suggested: Hablot Knight Browne ("Phiz")') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review comprehensive JSON file for detailed search results') print('2. Investigate highest-scoring findings for novel identification') print('3. Verify illustrator connections to both Dickens and Robertson novel') print('4. Cross-reference with library catalogs for complete bibliographic verification') print('5. Look for plot summaries to confirm character and setting details')
